member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.LearnColor(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Extracts the color features of an image, which can be used for color matching or other applications related with color information, such as color identification and color image segmentation. Use these features for color matching with the method.
member.param: The image containing the color information to learn.
member.returns: A object containing the color information, which can be passed to the method.
member.remarks: Use this method with Rgb32 and Hsl32 images.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.LearnColor(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Roi)
member.summary: Extracts the color features of an image, which can be used for color matching or other applications related with color information, such as color identification and color image segmentation. Use these features for color matching with the method.
member.param: The image containing the color information to learn.

Describes regions in the image that contain the color to be learned. If regions contains multiple region objects, the color information in all these regions is accumulated before learning. Pass null or Nothing for this parameter to learn color information about the whole image.
member.returns: A object containing the color information, which can be passed to the method.
member.remarks: Use this method with Rgb32 and Hsl32 images.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.LearnColor(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Roi,NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ColorSensitivity)
member.summary: Extracts the color features of an image, which can be used for color matching or other applications related with color information, such as color identification and color image segmentation. Use these features for color matching with the method.
member.param: The image containing the color information to learn.

Describes regions in the image that contain the color to be learned. If regions contains multiple region objects, the color information in all these regions is accumulated before learning. Pass null or Nothing for this parameter to learn color information about the whole image.

Specifies the sensitivity of the color information in the image. The sensitivity can be low, medium, or high. Set this value to high when you need to distinguish colors with close hue values. The default is Low.
member.returns: A object containing the color information, which can be passed to the method.
member.remarks: Use this method with Rgb32 and Hsl32 images.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.LearnColor(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Roi,NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ColorSensitivity,System.Int32)
member.summary: Extracts the color features of an image, which can be used for color matching or other applications related with color information, such as color identification and color image segmentation. Use these features for color matching with the method.
member.param: The image containing the color information to learn.

Describes regions in the image that contain the color to be learned. If regions contains multiple region objects, the color information in all these regions is accumulated before learning. Pass null or Nothing for this parameter to learn color information about the whole image.

Specifies the sensitivity of the color information in the image. The sensitivity can be low, medium, or high. Set this value to high when you need to distinguish colors with close hue values. The default is Low.

Sets a threshold value which the method uses to separate colors with similar hues. The function classifies colors below the given saturation value separately from colors above the given saturation value.
member.returns: A object containing the color information, which can be passed to the method.
member.remarks: Use this method with Rgb32 and Hsl32 images.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
'Learn the image in viewer1 and match it in viewer2. Dim ColorInfo as ColorInformation = Algorithms.LearnColor (imageViewer1.Image) Dim ColorScore as Integer = Algorithms.MatchColor (imageViewer2.Image, ColorInfo)(0)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.MatchColor(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ColorInformation)
member.summary: Determines how closely colors in an image match colors in the given color information.
member.param: The image containing colors you want to compare with the given color information.
The color information. Use the method to get the color information.
member.returns: A collection of integers containing the match score for the image. The match score is represented on a scale of 0 to 1000 where 0 indicates no match and 1000 indicates a perfect match.
member.remarks: Use this method with Rgb32 and Hsl32 images.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.MatchColor(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ColorInformation,NationalInstruments.Vision.Roi)
member.summary: Determines how closely colors in an image match colors in the given color information.
member.param: The image containing colors you want to compare with the given color information.
The color information. Use the method to get the color information.

The region of the image in which to compare the colors. All region contours are considered to be external. If roi contains multiple regions, the color information in each region is compared individually to the color information specified by the colorInformation parameter and the match results are reported for each region. Pass null or Nothing for this parameter to compare colors in the entire image.
member.returns: A collection of integers containing the match score for the image. The match score is represented on a scale of 0 to 1000 where 0 indicates no match and 1000 indicates a perfect match.
member.remarks: Use this method with Rgb32 and Hsl32 images.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
'Learn the image in viewer1 and match it in viewer2. Dim ColorInfo as ColorInformation = Algorithms.LearnColor (imageViewer1.Image) Dim ColorScore as Integer = Algorithms.MatchColor (imageViewer2.Image, ColorInfo)(0)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.GetMeterArc(NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MeterNeedleColor,NationalInstruments.Vision.LineContour,NationalInstruments.Vision.LineContour)
member.summary: Returns the arc information of a meter. The method uses this information to read a meter.
member.param: Determines whether to find a light-colored needle on a dark background or a dark-colored needle on a light background.
A line contour representing the minimum possible position of the meter needle.
A line contour representing the maximum position of the meter needle.
member.returns: A MeterArc object describing the arc across which a meter sweeps.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.GetMeterArc(NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MeterNeedleColor,NationalInstruments.Vision.Roi)
member.summary: Returns the arc information of a meter. The method uses this information to read a meter.
member.param: Determines whether to find a light-colored needle on a dark background or a dark-colored needle on a light background.

A region consisting of two line contours, each drawn from the tip of the needle to its base. The first line contour represents the minimum position of the needle, and the second line contour represents the maximum position of the needle.
member.returns: A MeterArc object describing the arc across which a meter sweeps.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
'Get the meter arc from the Roi in Viewer1. Dim Arc As MeterArc = Algorithms.GetMeterArc (MeterNeedleColor.DarkOnLight, imageViewer1.Image)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.GetMeterArc(NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MeterNeedleColor,NationalInstruments.Vision.PointContour,NationalInstruments.Vision.PointContour,NationalInstruments.Vision.PointContour)
member.summary: Returns the arc information of a meter. The method uses this information to read a meter.
member.param: Determines whether to find a light-colored needle on a dark background or a dark-colored needle on a light background.
The location of the base of the needle.
The location of the tip of the needle when the needle is at the minimum sweep position.
The location of the tip of the needle when the needle is at the maximum sweep position.
member.returns: A MeterArc object describing the arc across which a meter sweeps.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ReadMeter(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MeterArc)
member.summary: Reads a meter. The method reads VU-meters with a dark needle on a light background or with a light needle on a dark background. Use the method to determine the arc information.
member.param: The image containing the meter to read.
Information about the arc of the meter. This information is returned by the method.
member.returns: A object containing the location of the endpoint of the needle and the sweep position of the needle.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, I16, Single, Rgb32, Hsl32, RgbU64 images.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
Dim Arc As MeterArc
'Assumes the Arc has been populated with GetMeterArc. Dim Report As MeterReport = Algorithms.ReadMeter (imageViewer1.Image, Arc)

The type of the barcode to read.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ReadBarcode(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.BarcodeTypes,NationalInstruments.Vision.Roi)
member.summary: Reads a barcode from an image.
member.param: The image containing the barcode to read.
The type of the barcode to read.
A region of interest specifying the location of the barcode in the image.
member.returns: A object containing information about the barcode, including a string containing the decoded barcode data.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ReadBarcode(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.BarcodeTypes,NationalInstruments.Vision.Roi,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Reads a barcode from an image.
member.param: The image containing the barcode to read.
The type of the barcode to read.
A region of interest specifying the location of the barcode in the image.

Specifies whether to validate the barcode's data. If the barcode type is Codabar, Code 39, or Interleaved 2 of 5, the error correction information is used to validate the results. For all other barcode types, either no validation is performed or the validation is performed automatically because the type requires it. The default is False.
member.returns: A object containing information about the barcode, including a string containing the decoded barcode data.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, I16, Single, Rgb32, Hsl32, RgbU64 images.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
'Read the Ean8 barcode on the viewer. Dim Report As BarcodeReport = Algorithms.ReadBarcode (imageViewer1.Image, BarcodeTypes.Ean8, imageViewer1.Roi)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ReadPdf417Barcode(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Roi)
member.summary: Reads PDF417 barcodes from an image.
member.param: The image containing the PDF417 barcode to read.

A region of interest specifying the location of the barcodes in the image. The first contour of roi must be a rectangle, rotated rectangle, oval, annulus or closed contour. Pass null or Nothing for this parameter to use the entire image.
member.returns: A object containing information about the PDF417 barcodes, including a string containing the decoded barcode data.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8 images.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ReadPdf417Barcode(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Roi,NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Pdf417SearchMode)
member.summary: Reads PDF417 barcodes from an image.
member.param: The image containing the PDF417 barcode to read.

A region of interest specifying the location of the barcodes in the image. The first contour of roi must be a rectangle, rotated rectangle, oval, annulus or closed contour. Pass null or Nothing for this parameter to use the entire image.
Specifies the mode the method uses to search for barcodes.
member.returns: A object containing information about the PDF417 barcodes, including a string containing the decoded barcode data.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8 images.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis Imports System.Collections.ObjectModel
'Reads the PDF417 barcode on the viewer. Dim Reports As Collection(Of Pdf417Report) = Algorithms.ReadPdf417Barcode (imageViewer1.Image, imageViewer1.Roi, Pdf417SearchMode.Single)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.GradeDataMatrixBarcodeAim(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Grades a Data Matrix barcode using the AIM Print Quality metrics (included in the ISO 16022 specification).
member.param: The image containing the Data Matrix barcode to grade. You must first prepare this image for grading using the method.
member.returns: A object containing the AIM standard grades for the Data Matrix barcode and the raw scores used to derive the grades. If a Data Matrix barcode can not be located by the method, the method will assign the barcode an AimGrade of for all grades and 0 for all raw scores.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, I16, Rgb32, Hsl32, RgbU64 images.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
'Assumes the image in Viewer1 has already been read with 'Algorithms.ReadDataMatrixBarcode Dim GradeReport As AimGradeReport GradeReport = Algorithms.GradeDataMatrixBarcodeAim (imageViewer1.Image)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ShapeMatch(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Finds objects in an image whose shape matches the shape of the object specified by a template.
member.param: The image in which the function searches for shapes.
The 8-bit image containing the shape to find.
The resulting image that contains the objects in the source image that match the object in the template image.
member.returns: A object containing information about the matched objects.
member.remarks:
source and template must be U8 binary images that contain only pixel values of 0 or 1.
The matching process is invariant to rotation. You can set the match process to be invariant to the scale of the objects. This method labels each object in the image with a unique identification number before performing the match operation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ShapeMatch(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Finds objects in an image whose shape matches the shape of the object specified by a template.
member.param: The image in which the function searches for shapes.
The 8-bit image containing the shape to find.
The resulting image that contains the objects in the source image that match the object in the template image.
Set this parameter to True to search for shapes regardless of size. Set this parameter to False to search for shapes that are ± 10 percent the same size as the template shape. The default is True.
member.returns: A object containing information about the matched objects.
member.remarks:
source and template must be U8 binary images that contain only pixel values of 0 or 1.
The matching process is invariant to rotation. You can set the match process to be invariant to the scale of the objects. This method labels each object in the image with a unique identification number before performing the match operation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ShapeMatch(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,System.Boolean,NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Connectivity)
member.summary: Finds objects in an image whose shape matches the shape of the object specified by a template.
member.param: The image in which the function searches for shapes.
The 8-bit image containing the shape to find.
The resulting image that contains the objects in the source image that match the object in the template image.
Set this parameter to True to search for shapes regardless of size. Set this parameter to False to search for shapes that are ± 10 percent the same size as the template shape. The default is True.

Set this parameter to Connectivity8 to use connectivity-8 to determine whether particles are touching. Set this parameter to Connectivity4 to use connectivity-4 to determine whether particles are touching. The default is Connectivity8. For more information about connectivity, refer to the NI Vision Concepts Help.
member.returns: A object containing information about the matched objects.
member.remarks:
source and template must be U8 binary images that contain only pixel values of 0 or 1.
The matching process is invariant to rotation. You can set the match process to be invariant to the scale of the objects. This method labels each object in the image with a unique identification number before performing the match operation.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ShapeMatch(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,System.Boolean,NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Connectivity,System.Double)
member.summary: Finds objects in an image whose shape matches the shape of the object specified by a template.
member.param: The image in which the function searches for shapes.
The 8-bit image containing the shape to find.
The resulting image that contains the objects in the source image that match the object in the template image.
Set this parameter to True to search for shapes regardless of size. Set this parameter to False to search for shapes that are ± 10 percent the same size as the template shape. The default is True.

Set this parameter to Connectivity8 to use connectivity-8 to determine whether particles are touching. Set this parameter to Connectivity4 to use connectivity-4 to determine whether particles are touching. The default is Connectivity8. For more information about connectivity, refer to the NI Vision Concepts Help.
Specifies the allowable difference between the template shape and similar shapes in the image. The difference is expressed as a value from 0 to 1. The default is .03.
member.returns: A object containing information about the matched objects.
member.remarks:
source and template must be U8 binary images that contain only pixel values of 0 or 1.
The matching process is invariant to rotation. You can set the match process to be invariant to the scale of the objects. This method labels each object in the image with a unique identification number before performing the match operation.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis Imports System.Collections.ObjectModel
'Match the template shape stored in i in the image in Viewer1. 'Store the result in the image in Viewer2 Dim i As New VisionImage
'Convert the image in Viewer1 into a binary image Algorithms.Threshold (imageViewer1.Image, imageViewer1.Image, New Range(128, 255))
'Convert i into a binary image Algorithms.Threshold (i, i, New Range(128, 255))
'Perform the ShapeMatch Dim Reports As Collection(Of ShapeReport) = Algorithms.ShapeMatch (imageViewer1.Image, i, imageViewer2.Image)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.Centroid(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Computes the centroid of an image.
member.param: The image whose centroid the method calculates.
member.returns: The centroid of the image. On failure, an exception is thrown.
member.remarks: Use this method with image types U8, I16, and Sgl.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.Centroid(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Computes the centroid of an image.
member.param: The image whose centroid the method calculates.

Specifies the region in the image to use for computing the centroid. The method uses only those source image pixels whose corresponding mask pixels are non-zero to compute the centroid. Do not set this parameter if you want the method to use the whole image in the centroid calculation.
member.returns: The centroid of the image. On failure, an exception is thrown.
member.remarks: Use this method with image types U8, I16, and Sgl. mask must be a U8 image.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
Dim centroid As PointContour Dim maskImage As New VisionImage 'Do something here to populate the maskImage 'Calculate the centroid of the Image in Viewer1 using 'maskImage as a mask. centroid = Algorithms.Centroid (imageViewer1.Image, maskImage)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.Histogram(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Calculates the histogram, or pixel value distribution, of an image.
member.param: The image the method uses to compute the histogram.
member.returns: A HistogramReport describing the pixel value classification. On failure, an exception is thrown.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, U16, I16, and Single images.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.Histogram(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,System.Int32)
member.summary: Calculates the histogram, or pixel value distribution, of an image.
member.param: The image the method uses to compute the histogram.
The number of classes into which the method separates the pixels. The default is 256.
member.returns: A HistogramReport describing the pixel value classification. On failure, an exception is thrown.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, U16, I16, and Single images.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.Histogram(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,System.Int32,NationalInstruments.Vision.Range)
member.summary: Calculates the histogram, or pixel value distribution, of an image.
member.param: The image the method uses to compute the histogram.
The number of classes into which the method separates the pixels. The default is 256.

The minimum and maximum values for the range of pixel values to consider for the histogram. Pixel values outside of the range are not considered. The default value is (0, 0), which considers all pixels in the image.
member.returns: A HistogramReport describing the pixel value classification. On failure, an exception is thrown.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, U16, I16, and Single images.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.Histogram(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,System.Int32,NationalInstruments.Vision.Range,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Calculates the histogram, or pixel value distribution, of an image.
member.param: The image the method uses to compute the histogram.
The number of classes into which the method separates the pixels. The default is 256.

The minimum and maximum values for the range of pixel values to consider for the histogram. Pixel values outside of the range are not considered. The default value is (0, 0), which considers all pixels in the image.

the region in which the method computes the histogram. The method processes only those pixels in the image whose corresponding pixels in the mask are non-zero. Pass null or Nothing for this parameter if you want to calculate the histogram for the entire image.
member.returns: A HistogramReport describing the pixel value classification. On failure, an exception is thrown.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, U16, I16, and Single images. mask must be a U8 image.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
Dim Report As HistogramReport Dim Mask As New VisionImage
'Find the histogram of a portion of the image in Viewer1 'defined by the regions on Viewer1. Algorithms.RoiToMask (Mask, imageViewer1.Roi)
Report = Algorithms.Histogram (imageViewer1.Image, 256, New Range(), Mask)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.LineProfile(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Roi)
member.summary: Computes the profile of a line of pixels. This method returns other information such as pixel statistics and the coordinates of the pixels along the line.
member.param: The image on which the method computes the line profile.
The ROI containing the line along which the method computes the profile.
member.returns: A object containing information about the line.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, I16, Single, Rgb32, Hsl32, RgbU64 images.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.LineProfile(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.LineContour)
member.summary: Computes the profile of a line of pixels. This method returns other information such as pixel statistics and the coordinates of the pixels along the line.
member.param: The image on which the method computes the line profile.
The line along which the method computes the profile.
member.returns: A object containing information about the line.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, I16, Single, Rgb32, Hsl32, RgbU64 images.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
'This example requires you to have a ListBox named List1 on the form. Dim line As New LineContour (New PointContour (10, 10), New PointContour (100, 100)) 'Find the profile along the line in the image on Viewer1 Dim Report As LineProfileReport = Algorithms.LineProfile (imageViewer1.Image, line) 'Display the pixel values in the listbox If Report.ProfileData.Count > 0 Then List1.Items.Clear () For Each Val As Double In Report.ProfileData List1.Items.Add (val) Next End If

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.LinearAverages(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Computes the mean line profile of an image.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.Quantify(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Quantifies the contents of an image or the regions within an image. The region definition is performed with a labeled image mask. Each region of the mask has a single unique value.
member.param: The image to quantify.
member.returns: A conintaining information about the regions in the image.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, I16, and Single images.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.Quantify(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Quantifies the contents of an image or the regions within an image. The region definition is performed with a labeled image mask. Each region of the mask has a single unique value.
member.param: The image to quantify.

An 8-bit or 16-bit image specifying the regions to quantify in the image. Only the pixels in the original image that correspond to an equivalent pixel in the mask different from 0 are used for the quantification. Each pixel in this image (mask) indicates, by its value, which region belongs to the corresponding pixel in Image. Up to 255 regions for a U8, or 65,535 regions for an I16, can be quantified directly from the Image. Pass null or Nothing for this parameter to quantify the entire image.
member.returns: A conintaining information about the regions in the image.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, I16, and Single images.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
Dim MaskImage As New VisionImage Dim Report As QuantifyReport 'If there are regions on Viewer1 If imageViewer1.Roi.Count > 0 Then 'Create the mask from the regions you selected on Viewer1 Algorithms.RoiToMask (MaskImage, imageViewer1.Roi) 'Label the mask image Algorithms.Label (maskImage, maskImage) 'Quantify the image based on the regions Report = Algorithms.Quantify (imageViewer1.Image, maskImage) Else 'Quantify the entire image Report = Algorithms.Quantify (imageViewer1.Image) End If

member.summary: Thresholds an image. The method sets pixels values outside of the given range to 0. The method sets pixel values within the range to a given value or leaves the values unchanged.

The resulting image.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, I16, and Single images. This method is optimized for MMX.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.Threshold(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Range)
member.summary: Thresholds an image. The method sets pixels values outside of the given range to 0. The method sets pixel values within the range to a given value or leaves the values unchanged.
member.param: The image to threshold.
The resulting image.
The range of pixel values to keep. The default is (128,255).
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, I16, and Single images. This method is optimized for MMX.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.Threshold(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Range,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Thresholds an image. The method sets pixels values outside of the given range to 0. The method sets pixel values within the range to a given value or leaves the values unchanged.
member.param: The image to threshold.
The resulting image.
The range of pixel values to keep. The default is (128,255).
Set this parameter to True to set the pixel values within the range to 1. Set this parameter to False to leave the pixel values unchanged. This parameter has a default value of True.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, I16, and Single images. This method is optimized for MMX.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.Threshold(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Range,System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Thresholds an image. The method sets pixels values outside of the given range to 0. The method sets pixel values within the range to a given value or leaves the values unchanged.
member.param: The image to threshold.
The resulting image.
The range of pixel values to keep. The default is (128,255).

Set this parameter to True to set the pixel values within the range to the value specified in newValue. Set this parameter to False to leave the pixel values unchanged. This parameter has a default value of True.
If replaceValue is set to True, newValue is the replacement value for pixels within the range. If replaceValue is set to False, the pixel values are not changed. The default value is 1.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, I16, and Single images. This method is optimized for MMX.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
Dim i As New VisionImage
' Threshold the image in Viewer1 and store the result in i. Algorithms.Threshold (imageViewer1.Image, i, New Range(128, 255), True, 255)
' Threshold the image in Viewer1. ' Do the operation in-place. Algorithms.Threshold (imageViewer1.Image, imageViewer1.Image, New Range(128, 255), False)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.Threshold(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ThresholdData)
member.summary: Thresholds an image. The method sets pixels values outside of the given range to 0. The method sets pixel values within the range to a given value or leaves the values unchanged.
member.param: The image to threshold.
The resulting image.
The options to use to threshold the image.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, I16, and Single images. This method is optimized for MMX.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.MultiThreshold(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,System.Collections.ObjectModel.Collection{NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ThresholdData})
member.summary: Thresholds an image into multiple classes. The method classifies each pixel into the last threshold range of which it is a member. If a pixel is not a member of any of the given ranges, the method sets it to 0.
member.param: The source image.
The destination image.
The data required to perform the multithreshold.
member.remarks:
Use this method with U8, I16, and Single images.
The threshold operations are performed in the order that the data is received from ThresholdData. A pixel can be taken into account only once, even if the pixel is included in the threshold range of two different thresholds.
For example, consider the following ThresholdData input:
Item 1: ThresholdData.Range = (80, 150), UseNewValue = True, NewValue = 255
Item 2: ThresholdData.Range = (120, 200), UseNewValue = False
This example shows two threshold ranges with an overlap between 120 and 150. Therefore, the pixels between 120 and 150 are treated only by the second threshold. The following results occur after execution of this method:
Pixel values between 0 and 79 are replaced by 0.
Pixel values between 80 and 120 are replaced by 255.
Pixel values between 121 and 200 keep their original values.
Pixel values greater than 200 are set to 0.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis Imports System.Collections.ObjectModel
Dim i As New VisionImage Dim thresholdData As Collection(Of ThresholdData)
'AutoThreshold the image in Viewer1 into 3 classes 'Store the result in i thresholdData = Algorithms.AutoThreshold (imageViewer1.Image, i, 3)
'Use ThresholdData result to MultiThreshold the Viewer inplace Algorithms.MultiThreshold (imageViewer1.Image, imageViewer1.Image, thresholdData)

member.returns: A collection of ThresholdData objects that specifies the threshold ranges. On failure, an exception is thrown.

member.summary: Automatically thresholds an image into multiple classes.

The resulting U8 image.
The number of classes into which to threshold the image. Valid values range from 2 to 256.
Specifies the threshold method to use if numberOfClasses is 2. The method ignores this parameter if numberOfClasses is not 2.
member.returns: A collection of ThresholdData objects that specifies the threshold ranges. On failure, an exception is thrown.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.AutoThreshold(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,System.Int32,NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ThresholdMethod,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Automatically thresholds an image into multiple classes.
member.param: The image to process.
The resulting U8 image.
The number of classes into which to threshold the image. Valid values range from 2 to 256.
A value that specifies the threshold method to use if numberOfClasses is 2. The method ignores this parameter if numberOfClasses is not 2.

Specifies the region in which the method computes the method.The method processes only those pixels in the image whose corresponding pixels in the mask are non-zero. Do not set this parameter if you want to calculate the method for the entire image.
member.returns: A collection of ThresholdData objects that specifies the threshold ranges. On failure, an exception is thrown.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
Dim i As New VisionImage Dim ThresholdData(,) As Single
'AutoThreshold the image in Viewer1 into 3 classes 'Store the result in i Algorithms.AutoThreshold(imageViewer1.Image, i, 3, ThresholdMethod.Clustering, ThesholdData)
'Use AutoThreshold result to MultiThreshold the Viewer inplace Algorithms.MultiThreshold(imageViewer1.Image, imageViewer1.Image, ThresholdData)

The resulting image.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.LocalThreshold(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LocalThresholdOptions)
member.summary: Automatically thresholds an image into a binary image based on the requested local adaptive thresholding method.
member.param: The image to threshold.
The resulting image.

member.remarks: Use this method with U8 and I16 images. All of the images you pass to this method must be of the same type. The window size you specify in options should be sized as large as possible but small enough that each window contains pixels under similar lighting conditions. This method will produce inconsistent results for windows that contain uniform pixel values.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.MagicWand(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.PointContour)
member.summary: Creates an image mask by extracting a region surrounding a reference pixel, called the origin, and using a tolerance (+ or -) of intensity variations based on this reference pixel. Using this origin, the method searches for its neighbors with an intensity that equals or falls within the tolerance value of the point of reference. The resulting image is binary.
member.param: The source image containing the particle to mask.
The resulting image.
The origin.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, I16, and Single images. destination must be a U8 image. If source and destination are the same image, then source must be a U8 image.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.Fft(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Computes the Fourier transform of an image.
member.param: The source image.
The complex image containing the resulting FFT image.
member.remarks: source must be an U8, I16, Single, or Complex image. destination must be a Complex image. The image can be any size, but the method works faster if the image dimensions are in powers of 2. The source image and destination image must be different to perform this operation. This method is optimized for MMX.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
' Make i a complex image. Dim i As New VisionImage(ImageType.Complex)
' Perform an FFT on the image in Viewer1 and store the resulting complex image in i. Algorithms.Fft (imageViewer1.Image, i)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ComplexFlipFrequency(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Transposes the high and low frequencies of a complex image. The method flips the high and low frequency components of an FFT image to produce a central, symmetric representation of the spatial frequencies.
member.param: The source image.
The resulting image.
member.remarks: All images must be Complex.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
'Make i a Complex image Dim i As New VisionImage(ImageType.Complex) 'Flip the frequencies of the Complex image in Viewer1. 'Store the result in i. Algorithms.ComplexFlipFrequency (imageViewer1.Image, i)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.InverseFft(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Takes the inverse Fourier transform of an image.
member.param: The image whose inverse Fourier transform the method takes.
The resulting image.
member.remarks:
source must be a Complex image. destination must be a U8, I16, SGL, or Complex image. source and destination must be different to perform this operation.
This method uses a buffer equal to the size of the complex image. An 8-bit image with a resolution of 256 x 256 pixels uses 64 KB of memory. The FFT associated with this image requires eight times the memory, or 512 KB. The calculation of the inverse FFT also requires a temporary buffer of 512 KB. Therefore, the total memory necessary for this operation is 1080 KB.
This method is optimized for MMX.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
'This example assumes that the image in Viewer1 is a complex image. Dim i As New VisionImage
'Perform an inverse FFT on the image in Viewer1. 'Store the result in i. Algorithms.InverseFFT (imageViewer1.Image, i)

member.summary: Truncates the frequencies of a complex image.

The resulting image.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ComplexTruncate(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.TruncateMode,System.Double)
member.summary: Truncates the frequencies of a complex image.
member.param: The source image.
The resulting image.
Determines which frequencies are truncated. Set this parameter to to truncate the high frequencies or to truncate the low frequencies. The default is Low.

The percentage of the frequencies retained within a Fourier transformed (complex) image. The default value is 10 percent. The percentage works in conjunction with the length of the diagonal of the FFT image and the parameter truncateMode. For example, if you set truncateMode to and set ratioToKeep to 10 percent, the method retains 10 percent of the frequencies starting from the center (low frequencies). If you set truncateMode to and set ratioToKeep to 10 percent, the method retains 10 percent of the frequencies starting from the outer periphery. The default is 10.0.
member.remarks: All images must be Complex.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
'Make i a Complex image Dim i As New VisionImage(ImageType.Complex) 'Truncate the frequencies of the Complex image in Viewer1 at 25 percent. 'Store the result in i. Algorithms.ComplexTruncate (imageViewer1.Image, i, TruncateMode.Low, 25)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ExtractColorPlanes(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.ColorMode,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Extracts the three planes (RGB, HSL, HSV, or HSI) from an image. The type of planes that you extract does not need to be the same as the image type. For example, you can extract the Hue, Saturation, and Luminance plane from an Rgb32 image.
member.param: The color image from which the method extracts the color planes.
The color spaced used for the operation.
The image for the first extracted plane. It contains either the red plane (RGB) or the hue plane (HSL, HSV, or HSI).
The image for the second extracted plane. It contains either the green plane (RGB) or the saturation plane (HSL, HSV, or HSI).
The image for the third extracted plane. It contains either the blue plane (RGB), the luminance plane (HSL), the value plane (HSV), or the Intensity plane (HSI).
member.remarks: The source image must be Rgb32, Hsl32, or RgbU64 and the destination images must be U8 for Rgb32 and Hsl32 and I16 for RgbU64. Only the red, green, or blue plane can be extracted from RgbU64 images.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
' This example assumes that the image in Viewer1 is an Rgb32 image. Dim red As New VisionImage Dim green As New VisionImage Dim blue As New VisionImage Dim hue As New VisionImage Dim saturation As New VisionImage Dim luminance As New VisionImage Dim value As New VisionImage Dim intensity As New VisionImage
' Extract the red, green and blue planes from the image in Viewer1. Algorithms.ExtractColorPlanes (imageViewer1.Image, ColorMode.Rgb, red, green, blue)
' Extract the hue, saturation and luminance planes from the image in Viewer1. Algorithms.ExtractColorPlanes (imageViewer1.Image, ColorMode.Hsl, hue, saturation, luminance)
' Extract the hue, saturation, and intensity planes from the image in Viewer1. Algorithms.ExtractColorPlanes (imageViewer1.Image, ColorMode.Hsi, hue, saturation, intensity)
' Extract the hue, saturation, and value planes from the image in Viewer1. Algorithms.ExtractColorPlanes (imageViewer1.Image, ColorMode.Hsv, hue, saturation, value)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ReplaceColorPlanes(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.ColorMode,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Replaces one or more image planes from a color image (RGB, HSL, HSV, or HSI). The method replaces only the planes supplied as input. If all three planes are supplied, the source image is ignored, and only the destination image is used. The image is resized to the dimensions of the planes passed on input. Therefore, their sizes must be identical. If one or two planes are supplied, the planes must have the same dimension as the source image.
member.param: The source image.
The destination image.
The color space in which the function replaces planes.

The first plane of replacement data. For Rgb32 and Hsl32 images, the plane is a VisionImage object of type U8 that contains either the red plane (RGB) or the hue plane (HSL, HSV, or HSI). For RgbU64 images, the plane is a VisionImage of type I16 that contains the red plane (RGB). Pass null or Nothing for this parameter if you do not want to replace the red or hue plane.

The second plane of replacement data. For Rgb32 and Hsl32 images, the plane is a VisionImage object of type U8 that contains either the green plane (RGB) or the saturation plane (HSL, HSV, or HSI). For RgbU64 images, the plane is a VisionImage of type I16 that contains the green plane (RGB). Pass null or Nothing for this parameter if you do not want to replace the green or saturation plane.

The second plane of replacement data. For Rgb32 and Hsl32 images, the plane is a VisionImage object of type U8 that contains either the blue plane (RGB), the luminance plane (HSL), the value plane (HSV), or the intensity plane (HSI). For RgbU64 images, the plane is a VisionImage of type I16 that contains the blue plane (RGB). Pass null or Nothing for this parameter if you do not want to replace the blue, light, value, or intensity plane.
member.remarks: Use this method with Rgb32, Hsl32, and RgbU64 images. Only RGB planes can be replaced in an RgbU64 image. All source images must be the same size.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstrument.Vision Imports NationalInstrument.Vision.Analysis
Dim redPlane As New VisionImage 'Only replace the red plane of the image in viewer1. Algorithms.ReplaceColorPlanes (imageViewer1.Image, imageViewer1.Image, ColorMode.Rgb, redPlane, Nothing, Nothing)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ArrayToComplexPlane(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,System.Single[0:,0:])
member.summary: Replaces a plane of a complex image with the given array of pixel values.
member.param: The source image.
The destination image.
The 2D array of pixel values. This array must be the same size as source image.
member.remarks: source and destination must be complex images.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ArrayToComplexPlane(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,System.Single[0:,0:],NationalInstruments.Vision.ComplexPlane)
member.summary: Replaces a plane of a complex image with the given array of pixel values.
member.param: The source image.
The destination image.
The 2D array of pixel values. This array must be the same size as source image.
The plane to replace. Set this parameter to to replace the real plane or to replace the imaginary plane.
member.remarks: source and destination must be complex images.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
Dim i As New VisionImage Dim RealArray(,) As Single Dim ImaginaryArray(,) As Single
'Do something here to populate RealArray and ImaginaryArray so that 'they are the same size as the image in imageViewer1
'Replace the imaginary plane of the image in imageViewer1 with the data 'stored in the array named ImaginaryArray. 'Store the results in image i. Algorithms.ArrayToComplexPlane(imageViewer1.Image, i, ImaginaryArray, ComplexPlane.Imaginary)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ExtractComplexPlane(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Extracts a plane from a complex image and places the plane into another image.
member.param: The source image.
The resulting image containing the extracted plane.
member.remarks: Use this method with Complex images. The destination image must be a U8, I16, or Single image.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ExtractComplexPlane(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.ComplexPlane)
member.summary: Extracts a plane from a complex image and places the plane into another image.
member.param: The source image.
The resulting image containing the extracted plane.
The plane to extract. The default is ComplexPlane.Real.
member.remarks: Use this method with Complex images. The destination image must be a U8, I16, or Single image.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
'This example assumes that the image in Viewer1 is a Complex image 'and the image in Viewer2 is a Complex image.
'Set the plane types to Single Dim r As New VisionImage(ImageType.Single) Dim i as New VisionImage(ImageType.Single)
'Extract the real plane on the image in Viewer1 into r. Algorithms.ExtractComplexPlane (imageViewer1.Image, r, ComplexPlane.Real)
'Extract the imaginary plane on the image in Viewer1 into i. Algorithms.ExtractComplexPlane (imageViewer1.Image, i, ComplexPlane.Imaginary)
'Replace the real plane of Viewer2 with the data in r. Algorithms.ReplaceComplexPlane (r, imageViewer2.Image, ComplexPlane.Real)
'Replace the imaginary plane of Viewer2 with the data in i. Algorithms.ReplaceComplexPlane (i, imageViewer2.Image, ComplexPlane.Imaginary)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ReplaceComplexPlane(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Replaces a plane of a complex image with the pixel values from a given image
member.param: The image whose data the method modifies.
The destination image.
member.remarks: source must be a U8, I16, Single, or Complex image. destination must be a Complex image.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ReplaceComplexPlane(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.ComplexPlane)
member.summary: Replaces a plane of a complex image with the pixel values from a given image
member.param: The image whose data the method modifies.
The destination image.

The complex image plane to replace. Set this value to ComplexPlane.Real or ComplexPlane.Imaginary. If source is a Complex image, then this parameter also selects which plane of the source image is used as the replacement.
member.remarks: source must be a U8, I16, Single, or Complex image. destination must be a Complex image.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
'This example assumes that the image in Viewer1 is a Complex image 'and the image in Viewer2 is a Complex image.
Dim r As New VisionImage Dim i As New VisionImage
'Set the plane types to Single r.Type = ImageType.Single i.Type = ImageType.Single
'Extract the real plane on the image in Viewer1 into r. Algorithms.ExtractComplexPlane (imageViewer1.Image, r, ComplexPlane.Real)
'Extract the imaginary plane on the image in Viewer1 into i. Algorithms.ExtractComplexPlane (imageViewer1.Image, i, ComplexPlane.Imaginary)
'Replace the real plane of Viewer2 with the data in r. Algorithms.ReplaceComplexPlane (r, imageViewer2.Image, ComplexPlane.Real)
'Replace the imaginary plane of Viewer2 with the data in i. Algorithms.ReplaceComplexPlane (i, imageViewer2.Image, ComplexPlane.Imaginary)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.FindLcdSegments(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.RectangleContour)
member.summary: Calculates the region of interest of each digit from a rectangular area of interest around whole LCD and electroluminescent indicators, which can contain multiple digits. Use this method first in a calibration phase. You can process the ROI with the method. This method requires that all segments of the indicator are activated.
member.param: The image containing the LCD. All segments of the LCD must be on.
The rectangle containing the indicator.
member.returns: A region of interest containing contours around each digit.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, I16, and Single images. This method is designed for LCD and electroluminescent indicators. It is resistant to light drift.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.RoiToMask(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Roi)
member.summary: Transforms a region of interest (ROI) into a mask image.
member.param: The resulting mask image.
The ROI to transform.
member.returns: true if the ROI is a true representation of the mask.
member.remarks: destination must be a U8 image.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.RoiToMask(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Roi,NationalInstruments.Vision.PixelValue)
member.summary: Transforms a region of interest (ROI) into a mask image.
member.param: The resulting mask image.
The ROI to transform.
The pixel value of the mask. All pixels inside the region of interest take this value. The default is 255.
member.returns: true if the ROI is a true representation of the mask.
member.remarks: destination must be a U8 image.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.RoiToMask(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Roi,NationalInstruments.Vision.PixelValue,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Transforms a region of interest (ROI) into a mask image.
member.param: The resulting mask image.
The ROI to transform.
The pixel value of the mask. All pixels inside the region of interest take this value. The default is 255.

An optional template for the destination mask image. This parameter can be any image type that NI Vision supports. If you supply an imageModel, the mask image is the size of the model. If you set imageModel to null or Nothing, the size of mask is equal to the size of the bounding rectangle of the ROI, which reduces the amount of memory used. The method sets the offset of the mask image to reflect the real position of the ROI.
member.returns: true if the ROI is a true representation of the mask.
member.remarks:
destination must be a U8 image.
You can use this method in two ways. The simplest technique is to supply the imageModel parameter. In this case you can use the source image, in which the ROI was drawn, as a template for the final destination image by supplying imageModel. The output image automatically acquires the size of the image and location of the ROI as found in the original source image.
However, you do not have to supply the imageModel parameter. In this case the ROI requires an offset that is determined automatically from the upper-left corner of the bounding rectangle described by the ROI. These offset values are automatically set to the image mask.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
Dim i As New VisionImage
'Convert the ROI selected on Viewer1 into a mask and 'store the result in i. Algorithms.RoiToMask (imageViewer1.Image, imageViewer1.Roi)
'Convert the ROI selected on Viewer1 into a mask using 'the image in Viewer1 as a model and store the resulting 'mask image in the image in Viewer2. Algorithms.RoiToMask (imageViewer2.Image, imageViewer1.Roi, New PixelValue (255), imageViewer1.Image)

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.MaskToRoi(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Transforms a mask image into a region of interest (ROI) descriptor.
member.param: The mask image that the method transforms into an ROI. mask must be a U8 image.
member.returns: A object that contains the ROI and indicates whether the ROI is a true representation of the mask.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
'Get an ROI from the mask image in viewer1. Dim roi As Roi = Algorithms.MaskToRoiReport (imageViewer1.Image).Roi

The ROI describing the pixels about which the method gets information.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.TransformRoi(NationalInstruments.Vision.Roi,NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.CoordinateTransform)
member.summary: Rotates and translates a region of interest (ROI) from one coordinate system to another coordinate system within an image.
member.param: The ROI to transform.
Specifies how to transform pixel coordinates based on the difference between the reference coordinate system and the measurement coordinate system.

example.code:

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.CompareGoldenTemplate(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.InspectionAlignment)
member.summary: Compares a template image to an inspection image at a specified alignment.
member.param: The image to inspect.
The golden template to compare against the inspection image.
A reference to the destination image for bright and dark defects.
The location within the inspection image where the template image is located.
member.remarks:
Use one of the following methods of configuring the template image you want to use with this method:
Load a previously saved template image that you created using the NI Vision Template Editor.
To use the NI Vision Template Editor to configure a template image, click StartAll ProgramsNational InstrumentsVisionTemplate Editor
Use a method to learn the golden template image.
Use this method with U8 images.

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis
'Learn the golden template in viewer1. Algorithms.LearnGoldenTemplate (imageViewer1.Image) 'Compare this template with the image in viewer2. Dim Defects As New VisionImage Algorithms.CompareGoldenTemplate (imageViewer2.Image, imageViewer1.Image, Defects, New InspectionAlignment ()) 'Find the number of bad pixels. Dim HistogramReport As HistogramReport = Algorithms.Histogram (Defects) Dim NumberOfBadPixels As Integer = HistogramReport.NumberOfPixels - HistogramReport.Histogram(0)

example.code:
Imports NationalInstruments.Vision Imports NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis Imports System.Collections.ObjectModel
'Learn the geometric template in viewer1. 'Set the center of the template to (5, 10). Algorithms.LearnGeometricPattern (imageViewer1.Image, New PointContour(5, 10), 0) 'Match the template in viewer2, searching for 4 matches that could be rotated. Dim MatchOptions As New MatchGeometricPatternEdgeBasedOptions (GeometricMatchModes.ShiftInvariant + GeometricMatchModes.RotationInvariant, 4) Dim Matches As Collection(Of GeometricEdgeBasedPatternMatch) Matches = Algorithms.MatchGeometricPatternEdgeBased (imageViewer2.Image, imageViewer1.Image, New CurveOptions (), MatchOptions)

Searches for areas in an image that match a given geometric template image. Use the
method prior to using this method to ensure that the template image has been configured for the geometric pattern match stage.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ExtractTextureFeatures(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage)
member.summary: Extracts texture features from the image. Features are extracted by computing the wavelet bands from the image and then computing co-occurrence Haralick features from the extracted bands. The features are extracted within a specified window and the window is moved across the image from the top-left to the right-bottom corner.
member.param: Image Src is a reference to the source image.
member.returns: An instance of TextureFeaturesReport having wavelet Bands used and TextureFeatures extacted.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, U16 and I16 images.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ExtractTextureFeatures(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Roi)

member.param: Image Src is a reference to the source image.
ROI Descriptor specifies the region of the image in which to extract the texture features.
member.returns: An instance of TextureFeaturesReport having wavelet Bands used and TextureFeatures extacted.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, U16 and I16 images.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.CooccurrenceMatrixAnalysis(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,System.Int32)
member.summary: Performs the Cooccurrence Matrix Texture Analysis.
member.param: Image Src is a reference to the source image.
Cooccurrence Level specifies the number of gray levels the image is quantized to before the cooccurrence matrix is computed. The larger this value, the longer the VI will take to compute the matrix.
member.returns: Returns the Report having Cooccurrence Matrix and Feature Vector
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, U16 and I16 images.

member.returns: Returns the Report having Cooccurrence Matrix and Feature Vector

member.summary: Performs the Cooccurrence Matrix Texture Analysis.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.FindCircularEdge(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Roi)
member.summary: Detects circular edges inside an ROI, and optionally overlays the information used to search for the edges.
member.param: The input image.
The region of the image on which the method is performed. The first contour of roi must be a RectangleContour or RotatedRectangleContour.
member.returns: A FindCircularEdgeReport containing the information about the detected edges.
member.remarks: Use this method with U8, I16, Single, Rgb32, Hsl32, RgbU64 images.

member.remarks: Use this method with U8, I16, Single, Rgb32, Hsl32, RgbU64 images.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ClampMax(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Roi)
member.summary: ClampMax Measures a distance from outside-in by a simulating a clamping action. The clamping direction is governed by the ROI direction and can vary within a user-defined angle tolerance. When valid calibration is present, the distance is computed in pixel as well as real-world units.
member.param: The input image containing a contour.
It specifies roi to find clampMax.
member.returns: A ClampMaxReport containing the information about the Max clamp.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ClampMax(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Roi,NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.CurveOptions)
member.summary: ClampMax Measures a distance from outside-in by a simulating a clamping action. The clamping direction is governed by the ROI direction and can vary within a user-defined angle tolerance. When valid calibration is present, the distance is computed in pixel as well as real-world units.
member.param: The input image containing a contour.
It specifies roi to find clampMax.
Specifies what parameters will be used to extract curves from the inspection image.
member.returns: A ClampMaxReport containing the information about the Max clamp.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.ClampMax(NationalInstruments.Vision.VisionImage,NationalInstruments.Vision.Roi,NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.CurveOptions,NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ClampSettings)

When valid calibration is present, the distance is computed in pixel as well as real-world units.
member.param: The input image containing a contour.
It specifies roi to find clampMax.
Specifies what parameters will be used to extract curves from the inspection image.
Specifies clamp settings parameters to control the behavior of the clamp..
Specifies the information that is to be overlaid on the result image.
The coordinate system to which the ROI Descriptor is linked.
member.returns: A ClampMaxReport containing the information about the Max clamp.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Algorithms.CoresUsed
member.summary: This property allows you to specify how many processors all of your vision functions should take advantage of. The default is to use as many cores as possible. You may use this to get/set the number of cores to use. If a custom value is set to 0, this indicates use as many as possible, and the user is only allowed to specify as many cores as available by the operating system at maximum.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.InterpolationMethod
member.summary: Defines the interpolation method used.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.InterpolationMethod.ZeroOrder
member.summary: The method uses an interpolation method that interpolates new pixel values using the nearest valid neighboring pixel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.InterpolationMethod.Bilinear
member.summary: The method uses an interpolation method that interpolates new pixel values using a bidirectional average of the neighboring pixels.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.InterpolationMethod.Quadratic
member.summary: The method uses an interpolation method that interpolates new pixel values using a quadratic approximating polynomial.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.InterpolationMethod.CubicSpline
member.summary: The method uses an interpolation method that interpolates new pixel values by fitting them to a cubic spline curve, where the curve is based on known pixel values from the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.InterpolationMethod.BilinearFixed
member.summary: The method uses an interpolation method that interpolates new pixel values using a bidirectional average of the neighboring pixels. The function makes the averaging calculations using fixed-point mathematics, which increases the performance of the interpolation but reduces the accuracy.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.RegistrationMethod
member.summary: Specifies how the method registers the golden template and the image under inspection.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.RegistrationMethod.None
member.summary: No registration occurs.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.RegistrationMethod.Perspective
member.summary: Adjusts the image to correct for minor variations in alignment or perspective.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.NormalizationMethod
member.summary: Specifies how the method normalizes the template image relative to the inspection image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.NormalizationMethod.None
member.summary: No normalization occurs.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.NormalizationMethod.HistogramMatching
member.summary: Adjusts the image so its histogram is similar to the golden template's histogram.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.NormalizationMethod.AverageMatching
member.summary: Adjusts the image so its mean pixel value equals the golden template's mean pixel value.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Connectivity
member.summary: Defines which of the surrounding pixels of a given pixel constitute its neighborhood.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Connectivity.Connectivity4
member.summary: Only pixels adjacent in the horizontal and vertical directions are considered neighbors.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.Connectivity.Connectivity8
member.summary: All adjacent pixels are considered as neighbors.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.RangeType.OutsideRange
member.summary: Specifies that a match occurs when the measurement is outside the range of .

member.summary: Distance between opposite corners of the bounding rectangle.

member.summary: Perimeter of the smallest convex polygon containing all points in the particle.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MeasurementType.HolesPerimeter
member.summary: Sum of the perimeters of each hole in the particle.

member.summary: Distance between the start and end of the line segment connecting the two perimeter points that are the furthest apart.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MeasurementType.EquivalentEllipseMajorAxis
member.summary: Length of the major axis of the ellipse with the same perimeter and area as the particle.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MeasurementType.EquivalentEllipseMinorAxis

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MeasurementType.EquivalentRectShortSideFeret

member.summary: Average length of a horizontal segment in the particle.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MeasurementType.AverageVerticalSegmentLength

member.summary: Sum of the areas of each hole in the particle.

member.summary: Area of the smallest convex polygon containing all points in the particle.

member.summary: Number of holes in the particle.

member.summary: Number of horizontal segments in the particle.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrReadMode
member.summary: Specifies what OCR information is read.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrReadMode.All
member.summary: Reads both the character set data and the session properties from file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrReadMode.CharacterSetOnly
member.summary: Reads only the character set data from file.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrReadMode.PropertiesOnly
member.summary: Reads only the session properties from file.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrReadStrategy
member.summary: Specifies the level of checking that NI Vision performs when it reads text and analyzes it to determine if the read objects match trained characters.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrReadStrategy.Aggressive
member.summary: Configures NI Vision to perform fewer checks when analyzing objects to determine if they match trained characters. This option increases performance by 20 percent, but might result in inaccurate reads. You can successfully use the aggressive strategy for most cases. Use the aggressive strategy unless the character set or image quality requires more stringent analysis.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrReadStrategy.Conservative
member.summary: Configures NI Vision to perform more checks to determine if an object matches a trained character. This strategy is slower than the aggressive strategy, but it is more accurate and results in fewer mismatches.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrReadResolution
member.summary: Specifies the resolution the method uses to read characters. Refer to the NI OCR Training Interface Help for more information.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrReadResolution.LowResolution
member.summary: Configures NI Vision to use low resolution during the read process.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrReadResolution.MediumResolution
member.summary: Configures NI Vision to use medium resolution during the read process.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrReadResolution.HighResolution
member.summary: Configures NI Vision to use high resolution during the read process.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrThresholdMode
member.summary: Specifies how NI Vision calculates the threshold method you want to use to analyze an image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrThresholdMode.FixedRange
member.summary: Performs no automatic calculations. You manually set the threshold value. This mode provides the fastest thresholding method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrThresholdMode.ComputedUniform
member.summary: Calculates a single threshold value for the entire ROI.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrThresholdMode.ComputedLinear
member.summary: Calculates a value on the left side of the ROI, calculates a value on the right size of the ROI, and then linearly fills the middle values from left to right. The size of the steps from which to calculate the left and right values is based on the value of . Use this mode when the light intensity varies uniformly across the ROI.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrThresholdMode.ComputedNonlinear
member.summary: Divides the ROI into the number of blocks specified by , calculates a threshold value for each block, and then uses the value to extract pixel data.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrPredefinedCharacters
member.summary: Specifies the predefined characters for the corresponding character position.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrPredefinedCharacters.AnyCharacter
member.summary: Specifies that any character is valid for the corresponding position.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrPredefinedCharacters.UserDefinedCharacters
member.summary: Indicates that the valid characters for this position are specified by a user-defined character string.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrPredefinedCharacters.Alphabetic
member.summary: Specifies that the corresponding position can contain only alphabetical characters.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrPredefinedCharacters.AlphaNumeric
member.summary: Specifies that the corresponding position contains alphabetic characters and the numerical characters 0 to 9.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrPredefinedCharacters.UppercaseLetters
member.summary: Specifies that the corresponding position can contain only uppercase alphabetical characters.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrPredefinedCharacters.LowercaseLetters
member.summary: Specifies that the corresponding position can contain only lowercase alphabetical characters.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrPredefinedCharacters.DecimalDigits
member.summary: Specifies that the corresponding position can contain only numerical characters from 0 to 9.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrPredefinedCharacters.HexadecimalDigits
member.summary: Specifies that the corresponding position can contain only hexadecimal numerical characters, which includes 0 to 9 and A to F.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrPredefinedCharacters.Pattern
member.summary: Specifies that the corresponding position can contain only a pattern.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrPredefinedCharacters.ForceSpace
member.summary: Specifies that the corresponding position is ignored and is replaced by a space in the output string.
