member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SearchStrategy
member.summary: Specifies how the features of the image are used during the search phase. Use the search strategy parameter to optimize the speed of the pattern matching algorithm by allowing the algorithm to inspect less data from the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SearchStrategy.Conservative
member.summary: Instructs the pattern matching algorithm to use the largest possible amount of information from the image at the expense of slowing down the speed of the algorithm.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SearchStrategy.Balanced
member.summary: Instructs the pattern matching algorithm to balance the amount of information from the image it uses with the speed of the algorithm.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SearchStrategy.Aggressive
member.summary: Instructs the pattern matching algorithm to use a lower amount of information from the image, which allows the algorithm to run quickly but at the expense of accuracy.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SearchStrategy.VeryAggressive
member.summary: Instructs the pattern matching algorithm to use the smallest possible amount of information from the image, which allows the algorithm to run at the highest speed possible but at the expense of accuracy.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricMatchingSearchStrategy
member.summary: Specifies how the features of the image are used during the search phase. Use the search strategy parameter to optimize the speed of the pattern matching algorithm by allowing the algorithm to inspect less data from the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricMatchingSearchStrategy.Conservative
member.summary: Instructs the pattern matching algorithm to use the largest possible amount of information from the image at the expense of slowing down the speed of the algorithm.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricMatchingSearchStrategy.Balanced
member.summary: Instructs the pattern matching algorithm to balance the amount of information from the image it uses with the speed of the algorithm.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricMatchingSearchStrategy.Aggressive
member.summary: Instructs the pattern matching algorithm to use a lower amount of information from the image, which allows the algorithm to run quickly but at the expense of accuracy.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ContrastMode
member.summary: Specifies whether to search for matches with the same contrast or reverse contrast as the template.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ContrastMode.Original
member.summary: Searches for matches with the same contrast as the template.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ContrastMode.Reversed
member.summary: Searches for matches with the inverse contrast of the template.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ContrastMode.Both
member.summary: Searches for matches with the same contrast and inverse contrast.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LearnMode
member.summary: Specifies the invariance mode the method uses when learning the pattern.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LearnMode.All
member.summary: The method extracts information for shift- and rotation-invariant matching.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LearnMode.ShiftInformation
member.summary: The method extracts information for shift-invariant matching.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LearnMode.RotationInformation
member.summary: The method extracts information for rotation-invariant matching.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchMode
member.summary: Specifies how to look for the pattern in the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchMode.ShiftInvariant
member.summary: Searches for occurrences of the template image anywhere in the searchRect, assuming that the pattern is not rotated more than plus or minus 4 degrees.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchMode.RotationInvariant
member.summary: Searches for occurrences of the pattern in the image with no restriction on the rotation of the pattern.

member.summary: Write only the information needed to classify to the classifier file.

member.summary: Reads just the samples.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ReadClassifierFileMode.Properties

member.summary: This classifier has been trained with the Nearest Neighbor engine.

member.summary: The k-nearest neighbor method.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.NearestNeighborMethod.NearestPrototype
member.summary: The nearest prototype method.

member.summary: Specifies the metrics to use with the Nearest Neighbor algorithm.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.NearestNeighborMetric.Maximum
member.summary: The maximum metric.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.NearestNeighborMetric.Sum
member.summary: The sum metric.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.NearestNeighborMetric.Euclidean
member.summary: The Euclidean metric.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ThresholdMethod
member.summary: Defines how a method uses binary thresholding. For information about automatic thresholding methods, refer to the Thresholding section of the NI Vision Concepts Help.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ThresholdMethod.Clustering
member.summary: Sorts the histogram of the image within a discrete number of classes corresponding to the number of phases perceived in an image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ThresholdMethod.Entropy
member.summary: Best for detecting particles that are present in minuscule proportions on the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ThresholdMethod.Metric
member.summary: Calculates an optimal threshold value using the surfaces representing the initial gray scale. Well-suited for images in which classes are not too disproportionate.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ThresholdMethod.Moments
member.summary: Well-suited for images that have poor contrast.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ThresholdMethod.InterclassVariance
member.summary: Determines an optimal threshold by maximizing the between-class variation with respect to the threshold. Well-suited for images in which classes have well separated pixel value distributions.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ThresholdType
member.summary: Specifies the type of thresholding to use.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ThresholdType.Manual
member.summary: Uses manual thresholding. Manual thresholding is usesful if all the objects of interest in a grayscale image fall within a continuous range of intensities and you can specify the threshold range manually.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ThresholdType.Auto
member.summary: Uses automatic thresholding. Automatic thresholding is well-suited for conditions in which the light intensity varies from image to image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ThresholdType.Local
member.summary: Uses local thresholding. Use local thresholding to isolate objects of interest from the background in images that exhibit nonuniform lighting changes.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ColorClassifierResolution
member.summary: Specifies the color resolution of feature vectors.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ColorClassifierResolution.High
member.summary: Sets the color resolution to High, which enables 512 elements of feature vectors.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ColorClassifierResolution.Medium
member.summary: Sets the color resolution to Medium, which enables 128 elements of feature vectors.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ColorClassifierResolution.Low
member.summary: Sets the color resolution to Low, which enables 64 elements of feature vectors.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ParticleType
member.summary: Specifies what kind of particles to search for.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ParticleType.Bright
member.summary: Searches for bright particles.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ParticleType.Dark
member.summary: Searches for dark particles.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.KernelFamily
member.summary: Specifies the family of the kernel matrix. For more information about kernels, refer to the Image Processing topic of the NI Vision Concepts Help.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.KernelFamily.Gradient
member.summary: The kernel is in the gradient family. Gradient kernels highlight the variations of light intensity along a specific direction, which has the effect of outlining edges and revealing texture.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.KernelFamily.Laplacian
member.summary: The kernel is in the Laplacian family. Laplacian kernels highlight the variation of the light intensity surrounding a pixel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.KernelFamily.Smoothing
member.summary: The kernel is in the smoothing family. Smoothing kernels attenuate the variations of light intensity in the neighborhood of a pixel.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.KernelFamily.Gaussian
member.summary: The kernel is in the Gaussian family. Gaussian kernels attenuate the variations of light intensity in the neighborhood of a pixel. A Gaussian kernel is similar to a smoothing filter, but its blurring effect is more subdued.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SizeToKeep
member.summary: Determines the size of the particles the method keeps after the erosion.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SizeToKeep.KeepLarge
member.summary: The method keeps large particles remaining after the erosion.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SizeToKeep.KeepSmall
member.summary: The method keeps small particles eliminated by the erosion.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRPolarity
member.summary: Specifies the polarity of the QR code to search for.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRPolarity.AutoDetect
member.summary: The method should determine the polarity of the QR code.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRPolarity.BlackOnWhite
member.summary: The method should search for a QR code with dark data on a bright background.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRPolarity.WhiteOnBlack
member.summary: The method should search for a QR code with bright data on a dark background.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRMirrorMode
member.summary: Specifies if the QR code appears normally in the image of if the code appears mirrored in the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRMirrorMode.AutoDetect
member.summary: The method should determine if the QR code appears normal or mirrored.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRMirrorMode.Normal
member.summary: The method should expect the QR code to appear normal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRMirrorMode.Mirrored
member.summary: The method should expect the QR code to appear mirrored.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRModelType
member.summary: Specifies what type of QR code the detector will search for.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRModelType.AutoDetect
member.summary: Specifies that the method will auto-detect what type of matrix the QR code is.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRModelType.Micro
member.summary: Specifies the QR code is of a micro type. Micro QR codes have a single target in the top left of the code.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRModelType.Model1
member.summary: Specifies the QR code is of a model1 type. This means the code has target patterns in the top left, top right, bottom left, and no alignment patterns in the data.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRModelType.Model2
member.summary: Specifies the QR code is of a model2 type. This is most common type of QR code.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRRotationMode
member.summary: Specifies the amount of QR code rotation the method should allow for.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRRotationMode.Unlimited
member.summary: The method allows for unlimited rotation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRRotationMode.Degrees0
member.summary: The method allows for ±5 degrees of rotation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRRotationMode.Degrees90
member.summary: The method allows for between 85 and 95 degrees of rotation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRRotationMode.Degrees180
member.summary: The method allows for between 175 and 185 degrees of rotation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRRotationMode.Degrees270
member.summary: The method allows for between 265 and 275 degrees of rotation.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRDemodulationMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode the method should use to demodulate (determine which cells are "on" or "off") the QR code.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRDemodulationMode.AutoDetect
member.summary: The method will try each demodulation mode and use the one which decodes the QR code within the fewest iterations and utilizing the least amount of error correction.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRDemodulationMode.Histogram
member.summary: The method uses a histogram of all of the QR cells to calculate a threshold. This threshold determines if a cell is on or off. This is the fastest mode, but requires images with consistent levels of contrast.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRDemodulationMode.LocalContrast
member.summary: The method examines each of the cell's neighbors to determine if the cell is on or off. This mode is slower, but works with images that have inconsistent levels of contrast.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRDemodulationMode.Combined
member.summary: The method uses the histogram of the QR code to calculate a threshold. For cells with pixel values that are sufficiently below or above this threshold, the method will use the threshold to determine if the cell is on or off. If the cell pixel values are close to the threshold, the method will use the LocalContrast mode to determine if the cell is on or off. This mode is slower, but works with images that contain a QR code with extremely low cell fill percentages or gross print growth errors.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRDemodulationMode.All
member.summary: The method tries Histogram, then LocalContrast, and then Combined, stopping once one mode is successful.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRCellSampleSize
member.summary: Specifies the sample size, in pixels, the method should take to determine if each cell is on or off.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRCellSampleSize.AutoDetect
member.summary: The method will try each sample size and use the one which decodes the QR code within the fewest iterations and utilizing the least amount of error correction.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRCellSampleSize.Size1x1
member.summary: The method will use a 1x1 sized sample from each cell.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRCellSampleSize.Size2x2
member.summary: The method will use a 2x2 sized sample from each cell.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRCellSampleSize.Size3x3
member.summary: The method will use a 3x3 sized sample from each cell.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRCellSampleSize.Size4x4
member.summary: The method will use a 4x4 sized sample from each cell.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRCellSampleSize.Size5x5
member.summary: The method will use a 5x5 sized sample from each cell.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRCellSampleSize.Size6x6
member.summary: The method will use a 6x6 sized sample from each cell.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRCellSampleSize.Size7x7
member.summary: The method will use a 7x7 sized sample from each cell.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRCellFilterMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode used to determine the pixel value for each cell.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRCellFilterMode.AutoDetect
member.summary: The method will try all filter modes and uses the one that decodes the QR code within the fewest iterations and utilizing the least amount of error correction.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRCellFilterMode.Average
member.summary: The method sets the pixel value for the cell to the average of the sampled pixels.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRCellFilterMode.Median
member.summary: The method sets the pixel value for the cell to the median of the sampled pixels.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRCellFilterMode.CentralAverage
member.summary: The method sets the pixel value for the cell to the average of the pixels in the center of the cell sample.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRCellFilterMode.HighAverage
member.summary: The method sets the pixel value for the cell to the average value of the ninth of the sampled pixels with the highest pixel values.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRCellFilterMode.LowAverage
member.summary: The method sets the pixel value for the cell to the average value of the half of the sampled pixels with the lowest pixel values.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRCellFilterMode.VeryHighAverage
member.summary: The method sets the pixel value for the cell to the average value of the ninth of the sampled pixels with the highest pixel values.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRCellFilterMode.VeryLowAverage
member.summary: The method sets the pixel value for the cell to the average value of the ninth of the sampled pixels with the lowest pixel values.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRCellFilterMode.All
member.summary: The method tries each filter mode, starting with Average and ending with VeryLowAverage, stopping once a filter mode decodes correctly.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRStreamMode
member.summary: Specifies the format of the data encoded in the stream.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRStreamMode.Numeric
member.summary: Specifies that the data was encoded using numeric mode.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRStreamMode.Alphanumeric
member.summary: Specifies that the data is encoded using alpha-numeric mode.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRStreamMode.RawByte
member.summary: Specifies that the data was not encoded but is only raw binary bytes, or encoded in JIS-8.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRStreamMode.Ean128Token
member.summary: Specifies that the data has a special meaning represented by the application ID. The application ID is located in the tokenized data stream.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRStreamMode.Ean128Data
member.summary: Specifies that the data has a special meaning represented by the application ID.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRStreamMode.Eci
member.summary: Specifies that the data is meant to be read using the language represented in the language ID.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRStreamMode.Kanji
member.summary: Specifies that the data is encoded in Shift-JIS8 Japanese.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixGradingMode.PrepareForAim

member.summary: Sets the method to read Data Matrix barcodes with dark data on a bright background.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixPolarity.WhiteDataOnBlackBackground

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellFillMode
member.summary: Specifies the fill percentage for a cell that is in the "on" state.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellFillMode.AutoDetect
member.summary: Sets the function to determine the Data Matrix barcode cell fill percentage automatically.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellFillMode.Low
member.summary: Sets the function to read Data Matrix barcodes with a cell fill percentage of less than 30 percent.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellFillMode.Normal
member.summary: Sets the function to read Data Matrix barcodes with a cell fill percentage greater than or equal to 30 percent.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixMirrorMode
member.summary: Specifies if the Data Matrix barcode appears normally in the image or if the Data Matrix barcode appears mirrored in the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixMirrorMode.AutoDetect
member.summary: Specifies that the method should determine if the Data Matrix barcode is mirrored.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixMirrorMode.Normal
member.summary: Specifies that the method should expect the Data Matrix barcode to appear normal.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixMirrorMode.Mirrored
member.summary: Specifies that the method should expect the Data Matrix barcode to appear mirrored.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixRotationMode
member.summary: Specifies the amount of Data Matrix barcode rotation the method should allow for.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixRotationMode.Unlimited
member.summary: The method allows for unlimited rotation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixRotationMode.Degrees0
member.summary: The method allows for between -5 and 5 degrees of rotation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixRotationMode.Degrees90
member.summary: The method allows for between 85 and 95 degrees of rotation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixRotationMode.Degrees180
member.summary: The method allows for between 175 and 185 degrees of rotation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixRotationMode.Degrees270
member.summary: The method allows for between 265 and 275 degrees of rotation.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixDemodulationMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode the method should use to demodulate (determine which cells are on and which cells are off) the Data Matrix barcode.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixDemodulationMode.AutoDetect
member.summary: The method will try each demodulation mode and use the one which decodes the Data Matrix barcode within the fewest iterations and utilizing the least amount of error correction.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixDemodulationMode.Histogram
member.summary: The method uses a histogram of all of the Data Matrix cells to calculate a threshold. This threshold determines if a cell is on or off. This is the fastest mode, but requires images with consistent levels of contrast.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixDemodulationMode.LocalContrast
member.summary: The method examines each of the cell's neighbors to determine if the cell is on or off. This mode is slower, but works with images that have inconsistent levels of contrast.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixDemodulationMode.Combined
member.summary: The function uses the histogram of the Data Matrix barcode to calculate a threshold. For cells with pixel values that are sufficiently below or above this threshold, the function will use the threshold to determine if the cell is on or off. If the cell pixel values are close to the threshold, the function will use the LocalContrast mode to determine if the cell is on or off. This mode is slower, but works with images that contain a Data Matrix barcode with extremely low cell fill percentages or gross print growth errors.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixDemodulationMode.All
member.summary: The method tries Histogram, then LocalContrast and then Combined, stopping once one mode is successful.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellSampleSize
member.summary: Specifies the sample size, in pixels, the function should take to determine if each cell is on or off.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellSampleSize.AutoDetect
member.summary: The function will try each sample size and use the one which decodes the Data Matrix barcode within the fewest iterations and utilizing the least amount of error correction.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellSampleSize.Size1x1
member.summary: The function will use a 1 x 1 sized sample from each cell.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellSampleSize.Size2x2
member.summary: The function will use a 2 x 2 sized sample from each cell.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellSampleSize.Size3x3
member.summary: The function will use a 3 x 3 sized sample from each cell.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellSampleSize.Size4x4
member.summary: The function will use a 4 x 4 sized sample from each cell.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellSampleSize.Size5x5
member.summary: The function will use a 5 x 5 sized sample from each cell.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellSampleSize.Size6x6
member.summary: The function will use a 6 x 6 sized sample from each cell.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellSampleSize.Size7x7
member.summary: The function will use a 7 x 7 sized sample from each cell.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellFilterMode
member.summary: Specifies the mode the function uses to determine the pixel value for each cell.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellFilterMode.AutoDetect
member.summary: The function will try all filter modes and uses the one that decodes the Data Matrix barcode within the fewest iterations and utilizing the least amount of error correction.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellFilterMode.Average
member.summary: The function sets the pixel value for the cell to the average of the sampled pixels.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellFilterMode.Median
member.summary: The function sets the pixel value for the cell to the median of the sampled pixels.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellFilterMode.CentralAverage
member.summary: The function sets the pixel value for the cell to the average of the pixels in the center of the cell sample.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellFilterMode.HighAverage
member.summary: The function sets the pixel value for the cell to the average value of the half of the sampled pixels with the highest pixel values.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellFilterMode.LowAverage
member.summary: The function sets the pixel value for the cell to the average value of the half of the sampled pixels with the lowest pixel values.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellFilterMode.VeryHighAverage
member.summary: The function sets the pixel value for the cell to the average value of the ninth of the sampled pixels with the highest pixel values.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellFilterMode.VeryLowAverage
member.summary: The function sets the pixel value for the cell to the average value of the ninth of the sampled pixels with the lowest pixel values.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixCellFilterMode.All
member.summary: The function tries each filter mode, starting with Average and ending with VeryLowAverage, stopping once a filter mode decodes correctly.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixAdvancedProcessing
member.summary: Specifies the mode to use to determine the pixel value for each cell.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixAdvancedProcessing.LineDetection
member.summary: Enables the line detection algorithm. Use LineDetection if the image has a cluttered background.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixAdvancedProcessing.HighlightFilter
member.summary: Enables the highlight filter. Use the Highlight Filter if the image is blurry or has low contrast.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixAdvancedProcessing.AggressiveProcessing
member.summary: Enables aggressive reading. Aggressive reading returns the decoded code immediately without minimizing detected errors.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixAdvancedProcessing.EnableFNC1
member.summary: Enables decoding of FNC1 characters. Use this option if the data matrix code is GS1 compliant and encoded with FNC1 and Group Separators.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixAdvancedProcessing.RefineBoundingBox
member.summary: Enables refining the location of the bounding box. Use this option for a more consistent and accurate location.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.AimGrade
member.summary: Describes the letter grade assigned to a Data Matrix barcode based on the AIM Print Quality standard, where A represents the best grade and F represents the worst grade.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.AimGrade.F
member.summary: Assigns the Data Matrix barcode a grade of F.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.AimGrade.D
member.summary: Assigns the Data Matrix barcode a grade of D.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.AimGrade.C
member.summary: Assigns the Data Matrix barcode a grade of C.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.AimGrade.B
member.summary: Assigns the Data Matrix barcode a grade of B.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.AimGrade.A
member.summary: Assigns the Data Matrix barcode a grade of A.

member.summary: Searches for edges in a counter-clockwise direction.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ConcentricRakeDirection.Clockwise
member.summary: Searches for edges in a clockwise direction.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.EdgeProcess.FirstAndLast

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.EdgeProcess.All
member.summary: The method looks for all edges.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.EdgeProcess.Best
member.summary: The method looks for the best edge.

member.summary: Determines the polarity of edges to search for.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.EdgePolaritySearchMode.All
member.summary: Searches for all edges.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.EdgePolaritySearchMode.Rising
member.summary: Searches for rising edges only.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.EdgePolaritySearchMode.Falling
member.summary: Searches for falling edges only.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.EdgePolarity
member.summary: Specifies the polarity of an edge.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.EdgePolarity.Falling
member.summary: The edge is a falling edge.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.EdgePolarity.Rising
member.summary: The edge is a rising edge.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ColumnProcessingMode
member.summary: Specifies how the method processes the data extracted for edge detection.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ColumnProcessingMode.Average
member.summary: Averages the data extracted for edge detection.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ColumnProcessingMode.Median
member.summary: Takes the median of the data extracted for edge detection.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LocalThresholdMethod
member.summary: Defines the way the method performs the local threshold.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LocalThresholdMethod.NiBlack
member.summary: The method computes thresholds for each pixel based on its local statistics using the Niblack local thresholding algorithm.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LocalThresholdMethod.BackgroundCorrection
member.summary: The method performs background correction first to eliminate non-uniform lighting effects, then performs thresholding using the Otsu thresholding algorithm.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MorphologyMethod
member.summary: The morphological transformation the function applies. For more information about morphological transformations, refer to the Binary Morphology topic in the NI Vision Concepts Help.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MorphologyMethod.AutoMedian
member.summary: Uses dual combinations of openings and closings to generate simpler particles that have fewer details.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MorphologyMethod.Close
member.summary: A dilation followed by an erosion.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MorphologyMethod.Dilate
member.summary: Eliminates tiny holes isolated in particles and expands the contour of the particles.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MorphologyMethod.Erode
member.summary: Eliminates isolated background pixels.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MorphologyMethod.Gradient
member.summary: Extracts inner and outer contours of particles.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MorphologyMethod.GradientOut
member.summary: Extracts the outer contours of particles.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MorphologyMethod.GradientIn
member.summary: Extracts the inner contours of particles.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MorphologyMethod.HitMiss
member.summary: Eliminates pixels that do not have the same pattern as the structuring element.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MorphologyMethod.Open
member.summary: An erosion followed by a dilation.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MorphologyMethod.PClose
member.summary: A succession of seven closings and openings.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MorphologyMethod.POpen
member.summary: A succession of seven openings and closings.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MorphologyMethod.Thick
member.summary: Activates all pixels that match the pattern in the structuring element.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MorphologyMethod.Thin
member.summary: Deactivates all pixels that matches the pattern in the structuring element.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SkeletonMethod
member.summary: Specifies how the method calculates the skeleton. For more information about skeleton functions, refer to the Binary Morphology section in the NI Vision Concepts Help.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SkeletonMethod.L
member.summary: Uses an L-shaped structuring element in the skeleton function.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SkeletonMethod.M
member.summary: Uses an M-shaped structuring element in the skeleton function.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SkeletonMethod.Inverse
member.summary: Uses an L-shaped structuring element on an inverse of the image in the skeleton function.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ExtractionMode
member.summary: Specifies how the method identifies the locations of the curves in the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ExtractionMode.NormalImage
member.summary: Specifies that the method makes no assumptions about the uniformity of objects in the image or the image background.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ExtractionMode.UniformRegions
member.summary: Specifies that the method assumes that either the objects in the image or the image background consists of uniform pixel values. This allows the method to more accurately calculate the external curves of the objects.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.EdgeFilterSize
member.summary: Specifies the width of the edge filter the function uses to identify curves in the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.EdgeFilterSize.Fine
member.summary: Specifies that the method uses a fine, or narrow, edge filter.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.EdgeFilterSize.Normal
member.summary: Specifies that the method uses a normal edge filter.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.EdgeFilterSize.ContourTracing
member.summary: Sets the Edge Filter Size to contour tracing, which provides the best results for contour extraction but increases the time required to process the image.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LinearAveragesModes
member.summary: Specifies which mean line profiles the method calculates. Use bitwise-OR to combine two or more values in order to calculate multiple mean line profiles with one function call.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LinearAveragesModes.None
member.summary: Specifies that the method calculate no mean line profiles.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LinearAveragesModes.ColumnAverages
member.summary: Specifies that the method calculates the mean pixel value of each column.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LinearAveragesModes.RowAverages
member.summary: Specifies that the method calculates the mean pixel value of each row.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LinearAveragesModes.RisingDiagonalAverages
member.summary: Specifies that the method calculates the mean pixel value of each diagonal running from the lower left to the upper right of the inspected area of the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LinearAveragesModes.FallingDiagonalAverages
member.summary: Specifies that the method calculates the mean pixel value of each diagonal running from the upper left to the lower right of the inspected area of the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LinearAveragesModes.AllLinearAverages
member.summary: Specifies that the method calculates all four linear mean pixel values.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SymmetryOperation
member.summary: Specifies the type of symmetry to use.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SymmetryOperation.Horizontal
member.summary: Flips the image over the central horizontal axis.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SymmetryOperation.Vertical
member.summary: Flips the image over the central vertical axis.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SymmetryOperation.Central

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SymmetryOperation.DiagonalLeftToRight

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SymmetryOperation.DiagonalRightToLeft
member.summary: Flips the image over an axis from the upper right corner to lower left corner.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.RectangleOrientation.BaseOutside

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MathLookupOperator
member.summary: The transform function a method uses.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MathLookupOperator.Linear
member.summary: The method uses linear remapping.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MathLookupOperator.Log
member.summary: The method uses logarithmic remapping. Enhances contrast for small pixel values and reduces contrast for large pixel values.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MathLookupOperator.Exp
member.summary: The method uses exponential remapping. Enhances contrast for large pixel values and reduces contrast for small pixel values.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MathLookupOperator.Square
member.summary: The method uses square remapping. Similar to exponential remapping but with a more gradual effect.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MathLookupOperator.SquareRoot
member.summary: The method uses square root remapping. Similar to logarithmic remapping but with a more gradual effect.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MathLookupOperator.PowX
member.summary: The method uses power X remapping. Causes variable effect depending on power.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MathLookupOperator.Pow1X
member.summary: The method uses power 1/X remapping. Causes variable effects depending on power.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ComparisonFunction

member.summary: The comparison is true if the source pixel value is less than the comparison image pixel value.

member.summary: The comparison is true if the source pixel value is greater than or equal to the comparison image pixel value.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ComparisonFunction.ClearGreater
member.summary: The comparison is true if the source pixel value is greater than the comparison image pixel value.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ColorSensitivity
member.summary: Specifies the complexity of the color information in the image. In most cases, set this parameter to Low. However, set this parameter to High to use more information and better distinguish colors in highly complex images. As complexity increases, so does sensitivity. Two similar colors that may be identified as being the same with Low may be identified as different colors with High. Refer to the NI Vision Concepts Help for more information about color sensitivity.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ColorSensitivity.Low
member.summary: Instructs the algorithm to divide the hue plane into a low number of sectors, allowing for simple color analysis.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ColorSensitivity.Medium
member.summary: Instructs the algorithm to divide the hue plane into a medium number of sectors, allowing for color analysis that balances sensitivity and complexity.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ColorSensitivity.High
member.summary: Instructs the algorithm to divide the hue plane into a high number of sectors, allowing for complex, sensitive color analysis.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OutlineMethod
member.summary: Specifies how the method outlines edges.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OutlineMethod.Difference
member.summary: Produces continuous contours by highlighting each pixel where an intensity variation occurs between itself and its three upper-left neighbors.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OutlineMethod.Gradient
member.summary: Outlines contours where an intensity variation occurs along the vertical axis.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OutlineMethod.Prewitt
member.summary: Extracts the outer contours of objects.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OutlineMethod.Roberts
member.summary: Outlines the contours that highlight pixels where an intensity variation occurs along the diagonal axes.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OutlineMethod.Sigma
member.summary: Outlines contours and details by setting pixels to the mean value found in their neighborhood, if their deviation from this value is not significant.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OutlineMethod.Sobel
member.summary: Extracts the outer contours of objects. As opposed to the Prewitt filter, the Sobel filter assigns a higher weight to the horizontal and vertical neighbors of the central pixel.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricMatchModes
member.summary: Specifies the search mode the method uses to look for the template image in the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricMatchModes.ShiftInvariant
member.summary: Searches for occurrences of the template image in the inspection image, assuming that the template image is not rotated more than ± 5 degrees.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricMatchModes.RotationInvariant
member.summary: Searches for occurrences of the template image in the inspection image with reduced restriction on the rotation of the template image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricMatchModes.ScaleInvariant
member.summary: Searches for occurrences of the template image in the inspection image with reduced restriction on the size of the template image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricMatchModes.OcclusionInvariant
member.summary: Searches for occurrences of the template image in the inspection image, allowing for a specified percentage of the template image to be occluded.

member.summary: Contour Selection selects an extracted contour based on the property you choose

member.summary: Selects the curve closest to the ROI

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ExtractContourSelection.Longest
member.summary: Selects the curve with maximum length

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ExtractContourSelection.Strongest
member.summary: Selects the curve with the highest edge strength averaged from each point on the curve

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ConnectionConstraintType
member.summary: Type of connection constraint during contour extraction

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ConnectionConstraintType.Distance
member.summary: Specifies the distance, in pixels, within which the end points of two curves must lie in order to be considered part of a contour

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ConnectionConstraintType.Angle
member.summary: Specifies the range, in degrees, within which the difference between the angle of two curves, measured at the end points, must lie in order for the two curves to be considered part of a contour

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ConnectionConstraintType.Connectivity
member.summary: Specifies the distance, in pixels, within which a line extended from the end point of a curve must pass the end point of another curve in order for the two curves to be considered part of a contour

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ConnectionConstraintType.Gradient
member.summary: Specifies the range, in degrees, within which the gradient angles of two curves, measured at the end points, must lie in order for the two curves to be considered part of a contour

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SettingType
member.summary: Specifies the match option whose values you want to constrain by the given range

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SettingType.RotationAngle
member.summary: Set a range for this option to specify the angles at which you expect the Function to find template matches in the inspection image

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SettingType.Scale
member.summary: Set a range for this option to specify the sizes at which you expect the Function to find template matches in the inspection image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SettingType.Occlusion
member.summary: Specifies the distance, in pixels, within which a line extended from the end point of a curve must pass the end point of another curve in order for the two curves to be considered part of a contour

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData
member.summary: Determines the option you want to use during the matching phase

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.CurveExtractionMode
member.summary: Specifies how the function identifies curves in the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.CurveEdgeThreshold
member.summary: Specifies the minimum contrast an edge pixel must have for it to be considered part of a curve.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.CurveEdgeFilter
member.summary: Specifies the width of the edge filter that the function uses to identify curves in the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.MinimumCurveLength
member.summary: Specifies the length, in pixels, of the smallest curve that you want the function to identify.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.CurveRowSearchStepSize
member.summary: Specifies the distance, in the y direction, between the image rows that the algorithm inspects for curve seed points.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.CurveColSearchStepSize
member.summary: Specifies the distance, in the x direction, between the image columns that the algorithm inspects for curve seed points. Valid values range from 1 to 255. The default value is 15.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.CurveMaxEndPointGap
member.summary: Specifies the maximum gap, in pixels, between the endpoints of a curve that the function identifies as a closed curve.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.ExtractClosedCurves
member.summary: Specifies whether to identify only closed curves in the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.EnableSubpixelCurveExtraction
member.summary: The function ignores this option.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.EnableCorrelationScore
member.summary: Specifies that the function should calculate the Correlation Score and return it for each match result.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.EnableSubpixelAccuracy
member.summary: Determines whether to return the match results with subpixel accuracy.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.SubpixelIterations
member.summary: Specifies the maximum number of incremental improvements used to refine matches using subpixel information.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.SubpixelTolerance
member.summary: Specifies the maximum amount of change, in pixels, between consecutive incremental improvements in the match position before the function stops refining the match position.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.InitialMatchListLength
member.summary: Specifies the maximum size of the match list.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.EnableTargetTemplateCurveScore
member.summary: Specifies whether the function should calculate the match curve to template curve score and return it for each match result.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.MinimumMatchSeparationDistance
member.summary: Specifies the minimum separation distance, in pixels, between the origins of two matches that have unique positions.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.MinimumMatchSeparationAngle
member.summary: Specifies the minimum angular difference, in degrees, between two matches that have unique angles.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.MinimumMatchSeparationScale
member.summary: Specifies the minimum difference in scale, expressed as a percentage, between two matches that have unique scales.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.MaximumMatchOverlap
member.summary: Specifies whether you want the algorithm to spend less time accurately estimating the location of a match.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.EnableCoarseResult
member.summary: Specifies whether you want the algorithm to spend less time accurately estimating the location of a match.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.EnableCalibrationSupport
member.summary: Specifies whether or not the algorithm treat the inspection image as a calibrated image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.EnableContrastReversal
member.summary: Specifies the contrast of the matches to search for.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.SearchStrategy
member.summary: Specifies the aggressiveness of the strategy used to find matches in the image.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.RefinementMatchFactor
member.summary: Specifies the factor applied to the number of matches requested to determine how many matches are refined in the pyramid stage.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.SubpixelMatchFactor
member.summary: Specifies the factor applied to the number for matches requested to determine how many matches are used for the final (subpixel) stage.

member.name: F:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricSetupData.MaxRefinementIterations
member.summary: Specifies maximum refinement iteration.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.InspectionOptions.NormalizationMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets how the function normalizes the golden template to the inspection image.
member.remarks:
You can use the following constants with this data type:
AverageMatching—Normalize image by shifting intensities by the difference in the mean values.
HistogramMatching—Normalize image using histogram matching.
None—No normalization.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.InspectionOptions.RegistrationMethod
member.summary: Gets or sets the manner in which the function registers the golden template and the inspection image.
member.remarks:
You can use the following constants with this data type:
None—No registration.
PerspectiveRegistration—Use perspective correction registration.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LearnPatternAdvancedShiftOptions.SubpixelSampleSizeFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the sample for the subpixel phase of shift-invariant matching as a percent of the template size, in pixels.
member.value: The default is 0, which causes the algorithm to use SubpixelSampleSize. For optimal speed, the algorithm coerces sizes that are less than 240 to an integer multiple of 12 and coerces sizes greater than 240 to an integer multiple of 60.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LearnPatternAdvancedShiftOptions.SubpixelSampleSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of template pixels that you want to include in a sample for the subpixel phase of shift-invariant matching.
member.value: The default is 0, which allows the algorithm to compute SubpixelSampleSize. For optimal speed, the algorithm coerces sizes that are less than 240 to an integer multiple of 12 and coerces sizes greater than 240 to an integer multiple of 60.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LearnPatternAdvancedShiftOptions.FinalSampleSizeFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the sample for the final phase of shift-invariant matching as a percent of the edge points in the template, in pixels.
member.value: The default is 0, which causes the algorithm to use FinalSampleSize. If you provide values for both FinalSampleSizeFactor and FinalSampleSize, the algorithm uses the FinalSampleSize. For optimal speed, the algorithm coerces sizes that are less than 240 to an integer multiple of 12 and coerces sizes greater than 240 to an integer multiple of 60.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LearnPatternAdvancedShiftOptions.FinalSampleSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of template pixels you want to add to the InitialSampleSize for the final phase of shift-invariant matching.
member.value: The default is 0, which allows the algorithm to compute the FinalSampleSize. For optimal speed, the algorithm coerces sizes that are less than 240 to an integer multiple of 12 and coerces sizes greater than 240 to an integer multiple of 60.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LearnPatternAdvancedShiftOptions.InitialSampleSizeFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the sample for the initial phase of shift-invariant matching as a percent of the template size, in pixels.
member.value: The default is 0, which causes the algorithm to use InitialSampleSize. If you provide values for both InitialSampleSizeFactor and InitialSampleSize, the algorithm uses InitialSampleSize. For optimal speed, the algorithm coerces sizes that are less than 240 to an integer multiple of 12 and coerces sizes greater than 240 to an integer multiple of 60.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LearnPatternAdvancedShiftOptions.InitialSampleSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of template pixels that you want to include in a sample for the initial phase of shift-invariant matching.
member.value: The default is 0, which allows the algorithm to compute the InitialSampleSize. For optimal speed, the algorithm coerces sizes that are less than 240 to an integer multiple of 12 and coerces sizes greater than 240 to an integer multiple of 60.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LearnPatternAdvancedShiftOptions.InitialStepSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the largest number of image pixels to shift the sample across the inspection image during the initial phase of shift-invariant matching.
member.value: The default is 7. The algorithm may reduce the value of InitialStepSize based on InitialSampleSize and the template image. If the step size is not an odd integer, the algorithm coerces it to the next smaller odd integer.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LearnPatternAdvancedRotationOptions.FinalAngularAccuracy
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle accuracy, in degrees, to use during the final phase of the rotation-invariant matching.
member.value: The default is 1 degree. Use subpixel accuracy to achieve angle accuracy less than the default. This value must be no greater than the value for InitialAngularAccuracy. The algorithm coerces the angle to the largest integer smaller than it that evenly divides 360. This option is not used in conjunction with the Aggressive search strategy.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LearnPatternAdvancedRotationOptions.InitialAngularAccuracy
member.summary: Gets or sets the angle accuracy, in degrees, to use during the initial phase of rotation-invariant matching.
member.value: The default is 6 degrees. The algorithm coerces the angle to the largest integer smaller than it that evenly divides 360. This option is not used in conjunction with the Aggressive search strategy.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchPatternAdvancedOptions
member.summary:
Optimizes the performance of the
method and fine-tunes the matches located by the method.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchPatternAdvancedOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the MatchPatternAdvancedOptions class.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchPatternAdvancedOptions.#ctor(NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SearchStrategy)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the MatchPatternAdvancedOptions class.
member.param: Specifies the aggressiveness of the rotation search strategy.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchPatternAdvancedOptions.#ctor(NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.SearchStrategy,System.Int32,System.Double,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the MatchPatternAdvancedOptions class.
member.param: Specifies the aggressiveness of the rotation search strategy.

Specifies the maximum number of incremental improvements used to refine matching using subpixel information.
If you provide values for both subpixelIterations and subpixelTolerance, the algorithm refines the match for at most subpixelIterations but may stop early if SubpixelTolerance is satisfied. If you set subpixelTolerance, matches may be invalidated during the subpixel matching process. However, using subpixelIterations alone cannot invalidate a match.
Specifies the maximum amount of change, in pixels, between consecutive incremental improvements in the match position that you want to trigger the end of the refinement process.
Specifies the maximum size of the match list. The match list contains the regions in the inspection image that have the highest probability of containing a match.
Specifies the reduction of the match list as matches are refined.
Specifies the number of pixels to shift the sample across the inspection image during the initial phase of shift-invariant matching.
Specifies the accuracy, in degrees, to use during the intermediate phase of rotation-invariant matching.

member.summary: Gets or sets the accuracy, in degrees, to use during the intermediate phase of rotation-invariant matching.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchPatternAdvancedOptions.SearchStrategy
member.summary: Gets or sets the aggressiveness of the rotation search strategy.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchPatternAdvancedOptions.InitialStepSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of pixels to shift the sample across the inspection image during the initial phase of shift-invariant matching.
member.value: The default is 0, which uses the InitialStepSize stored in the template. If the step size is not an odd integer, the algorithm uses the default value.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchPatternAdvancedOptions.MatchListReductionFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the reduction of the match list as matches are refined.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchPatternAdvancedOptions.InitialMatchListLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of the match list. The match list contains the regions in the inspection image that have the highest probability of containing a match.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchPatternAdvancedOptions.SubpixelTolerance
member.summary:
Gets or sets the maximum amount of change, in pixels, between consecutive incremental improvements in the match position that you want to trigger the end of the refinement process.
If you provide values for both SubpixelIterations and SubpixelTolerance, the algorithm refines the match for at most SubpixelIterations but may stop early if SubpixelTolerance is satisfied. If you set SubpixelTolerance, matches may be invalidated during the subpixel matching process. However, using SubpixelIterations alone cannot invalidate a match. This behavior is particularly important when using the
method.
member.value: The default is 0, which specifies using the SubpixelIterations value.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchPatternAdvancedOptions.SubpixelIterations
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of incremental improvements used to refine matching using subpixel information.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.LearnGeometricPatternEdgeBasedAdvancedOptions.ImageSamplingFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets the factor that is used to subsample the template and the image for the initial matching phase. The image is subsampled by a power of 2 factor that is less than or equal to the specified value.
member.value: The default is 0, which specifies that the subsamping factor is automatically determined.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchGeometricPatternFeatureBasedAdvancedOptions.SmoothContours
member.summary: Gets or sets whether or not smoothing be done on the contours of the inspection image before feature extraction. Set this element to to specify smoothing be done on the contours of the inspection image before feature extraction.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchGeometricPatternFeatureBasedAdvancedOptions.TargetTemplateCurveScore
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the method should calculate the match curve to template curve score. Set this element to to specify that the method should calculate the match curve to template curve score and return it for each match result. Set this element to to specify that the method should not calculate the match curve to template curve score.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchGeometricPatternFeatureBasedAdvancedOptions.FeaturesUsedRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the range of the number of features the method uses when matching.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchGeometricPatternFeatureBasedAdvancedOptions.SubpixelIterations
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of incremental improvements used to refine matches with subpixel information.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchGeometricPatternFeatureBasedAdvancedOptions.SubpixelTolerance
member.summary:
Gets or sets the maximum amount of change, in pixels, between consecutive incremental improvements in the match position before the method stops refining the match position.
Set this parameter to 0 to specify that the method should always use a number of refinements equal to SubpixelIterations. If you provide values for both SubpixelIterations and SubpixelTolerance, the method refines the match for, at most, SubpixelIterations but may stop early if SubpixelTolerance is satisfied. If you set SubpixelTolerance, the method may invalidate matches during the subpixel refinement process. However, using SubpixelIterations alone cannot invalidate a match.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchGeometricPatternFeatureBasedAdvancedOptions.InitialMatchListLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum size of the match list. The match list contains the regions in the inspection image that have the highest probability of containing a match.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchGeometricPatternFeatureBasedAdvancedOptions.CorrelationScore
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the method should calculate the correlation score. Set this parameter to to specify that the method should calculate the correlation score and return it for each match result. Set this parameter to to specify that the method should not calculate the correlation score.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchGeometricPatternFeatureBasedAdvancedOptions.MinimumMatchSeparationDistance
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum separation distance, in pixels, between the origins of two matches that have unique positions. The method does not return matches that have the same position, scale, and angle. Set this value to -1 if you do not want the method to use the position of a match to determine whether the match is unique.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchGeometricPatternFeatureBasedAdvancedOptions.MinimumMatchSeparationAngle
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum angular difference, in degrees, between two matches that have unique angles. The method does not return matches that have the same position, scale, and angle. Set this value to -1 if you do not want the method to use the angle of a match to determine whether the match is unique.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchGeometricPatternFeatureBasedAdvancedOptions.MinimumMatchSeparationScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum difference in scale, expressed as a percentage, between two matches that have unique scales. The method does not return matches that have the same position, scale, and angle. Set this value to -1 if you do not want the method to use the scale of a match to determine whether the match is unique.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchGeometricPatternFeatureBasedAdvancedOptions.MaximumMatchOverlap
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum amount of overlap, expressed as a percentage, allowed between the bounding rectangles of two unique matches. The method does not return matches that exceed this overlap percentage. Set this value to -1 if you want the method to ignore bounding rectangle overlap.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchGeometricPatternFeatureBasedAdvancedOptions.CoarseResult
member.summary: Gets or sets whether you want the method to spend less time accurately estimating the location of a match. Set this value to if you want to quickly determine whether a part is present in the inspection image without an accurate estimate of its position, angle, and scale. Set this value to to specify that the method returns matches with pixel or subpixel accuracy.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchGeometricPatternFeatureBasedAdvancedOptions.EnableCalibrationSupport
member.summary:
Gets or sets whether to treat the inspection image as a calibrated image. Set this parameter to to specify that the method treat the inspection image as a calibrated image. Use the
method or the
method to calibrate the inspection image.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchGeometricPatternEdgeBasedOptions.ScaleRange
member.summary: Gets or sets a range that specifies the sizes of the pattern you expect to be in the image, expressed as a ratio percentage representing the size of the pattern in the image divided by size of the original pattern multiplied by 100.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchGeometricPatternEdgeBasedOptions.OcclusionRange
member.summary: Gets or sets what percentage of the template image you expect to be occluded in the image.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchGeometricPatternEdgeBasedOptions.MinimumMatchScore
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum score a match can have for the method to consider the match valid. Acceptable values range from 0 to 1,000.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchGeometricPatternEdgeBasedOptions.NumberOfMatchesRequested
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of valid matches expected.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchGeometricPatternEdgeBasedOptions.SubpixelAccuracy
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to calculate match locations with subpixel accuracy. Set this parameter to to specify that the function should calculate match locations with subpixel accuracy. Set this element to to specify that the function should calculate match locations with pixel accuracy.

member.summary: Gets or sets the advanced options to the algorithm.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricFeatureBasedPatternMatch.CalibratedCorners
member.summary: Gets an array of four points describing the rectangle surrounding the template image.
member.remarks: If the image where the match is found is a calibrated image, then this value describes the calibrated rectangle.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricFeatureBasedPatternMatch.CalibratedRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation of the match relative to the template image, in degrees.
member.remarks: If the image where the match is found is a calibrated image, then this value is in real-world units. Otherwise, this value is the same as .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricFeatureBasedPatternMatch.CalibratedPosition
member.summary: Gets or sets the location of the origin of the template in the match.
member.remarks: If the image where the match is found is a calibrated image, then this value is in real-world units. Otherwise, this value is the same as .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricFeatureBasedPatternMatch.Features
member.summary: Gets or sets the features uses in this match.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricFeatureBasedPatternMatch.CorrelationScore
member.summary: Gets or sets the accuracy of the match obtained by comparing the template image to the match region using a correlation metric that compares the two regions as a function of their pixel values.
member.remarks: A score of 1,000 indicates a perfect match, and a score of 0 indicates no match.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricFeatureBasedPatternMatch.MatchTemplateCurveScore
member.summary: Gets or sets the accuracy of the match obtained by comparing the curves in the match region to the template curves.
member.remarks: A score of 1,000 indicates a perfect match, and a score of 0 indicates no match.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricFeatureBasedPatternMatch.TemplateMatchCurveScore
member.summary: Gets or sets the accuracy of the match obtained by comparing the template curves to the curves in the match region.
member.remarks: A score of 1,000 indicates a perfect match, and a score of 0 indicates no match.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricFeatureBasedPatternMatch.Occlusion
member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage of the match that is occluded.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricFeatureBasedPatternMatch.Inverse
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the match is an inverse of the template image.
member.remarks: This element is if the match is an inverse of the template image. For example, the match is a white object on a black background but the template image is a black object on a white background. This element is if the match and the template image have the same contrast with the image background.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricEdgeBasedPatternMatch.TemplateMatchCurveScore
member.summary: Gets or sets the accuracy of the match obtained by comparing the template curves to the curves in the match region.
member.remarks: A score of 1,000 indicates a perfect match, and a score of 0 indicates no match.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricEdgeBasedPatternMatch.MatchTemplateCurveScore
member.summary: Gets or sets the accuracy of the match obtained by comparing the curves in the match region to the template curves.
member.remarks: A score of 1,000 indicates a perfect match, and a score of 0 indicates no match.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricEdgeBasedPatternMatch.CorrelationScore
member.summary: Gets or sets the accuracy of the match obtained by comparing the template image to the match region using a correlation metric that compares the two regions as a function of their pixel values.
member.remarks: A score of 1,000 indicates a perfect match, and a score of 0 indicates no match.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.GeometricEdgeBasedPatternMatch.CalibratedRotation
member.summary: Gets or sets the rotation of the match relative to the template image, in degrees.
