member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrReadTextOptions
member.summary: Configures how text is read.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrReadTextOptions.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of this instance to its equivalent string representation.
member.returns: A string representation of the value of this instance.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrReadTextOptions.ReadResolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the read resolution, which determines how much of the trained character data is used to match objects to trained characters.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrReadTextOptions.AspectRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the aspect ratio. Set this property to 0 to read text without considering the aspect ratio. Set this property to a minimum value of 100 to consider the aspect ratio when reading text. Setting the aspect ratio to 100 indicates that you expect the read character to be exactly the same size as the trained character. This property does not have a maximum value.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrReadTextOptions.AcceptanceLevel
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum acceptance level at which an object is considered a trained character. The range of valid values for this attribute is 0 to 1,000.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrReadTextOptions.ReadStrategy
member.summary: Gets or sets the possible read strategies. The read strategy determines how closely images are analyzed to match objects with trained characters.
member.value: The default is Aggressive, which means that few criteria is used to analyze images.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrReadTextOptions.SubstitutionCharacter
member.summary:
Gets or sets the character that
substitutes for objects it cannot match with any of the trained characters.
member.value: The default is a question mark (?).

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrReadTextOptions.ValidCharacters
member.summary: Gets the characters that are compared against read characters during the reading process.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrProcessingOptions
member.summary: Configures how to train or read characters.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrProcessingOptions.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of this instance to its equivalent string representation.
member.returns: A string representation of the value of this instance.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrProcessingOptions.ErosionCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of erosions to perform. After performing the erosions, the method restores the remaining objects to their original uneroded size. Set this attribute to 0 if you do not want to remove small particles.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrProcessingOptions.RemoveParticlesTouchingRoi
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to remove particles touching the ROI. Set this element to to remove the particles touching the ROI. Set this element to to include the particles touching the ROI.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrProcessingOptions.DarkCharacters
member.summary: Gets or sets which pixel intensity to read or train in the image. Set this element to to read or train dark characters on a light background. Set this element to to read or train light characters on a dark background.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrProcessingOptions.BiModalCalculation
member.summary: Gets or sets how to calculate low and high threshold values when the threshold calculation is optimized. Set this parameter to to calculate both the low and high threshold values when using the fast thresholding method. Set this parameter to to calculate only the high threshold value when reading or training dark characters and to calculate only the low threshold value when reading or training light characters. This option is available only when FastThreshold is .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrProcessingOptions.FastThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to use a faster, less accurate threshold. Set this parameter to to use a faster, less accurate threshold calculation algorithm. Set this parameter to to use a slower, more accurate threshold calculation algorithm.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrProcessingOptions.BlockCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of blocks for threshold calculation algorithms that require blocks. Valid values range from 4 to 50.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrProcessingOptions.ThresholdRange
member.summary: Gets the low and high threshold values when you set Mode to FixedRange.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrProcessingOptions.ThresholdLimits
member.summary: Gets the lower and upper threshold limits to establish a limit on the threshold calculated by the automatic threshold calculation algorithms.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrProcessingOptions.Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets the thresholding mode.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrSpacingOptions
member.summary: Character size and spacing constraints you want to use during the training or reading process.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrSpacingOptions.ToString
member.summary: Converts the value of this instance to its equivalent string representation.
member.returns: A string representation of the value of this instance.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrSpacingOptions.AutoSplit
member.summary: Gets or sets whether to split overlapping characters. Set this parameter to to automatically adjust the location of the character bounding rectangle when characters overlap vertically. This parameter is useful when you are working with an image that contains slanted characters. If the characters are not slanted and/or do not overlap vertically, set this parameter to .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrSpacingOptions.BoundingRectHeightRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum and maximum possible height, in pixels, for a character bounding rectangle. The minimum acceptable value for this parameter is 1. Set the maximum value to 65536 to specify that all heights greater than the minimum value are acceptable.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrSpacingOptions.BoundingRectWidthRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum and maximum possible width, in pixels, for a character bounding rectangle. The minimum acceptable value for this parameter is 1. Set the maximum value to 65536 to specify that all widths greater than the minimum value are acceptable.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrSpacingOptions.MaximumVerticalElementSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum vertical element spacing in pixels. Elements whose spacing from the main character element exceeds MaximumVerticalElementSpacing are not used for training or reading. Set this parameter to 0 to specify that any element in the ROI should be considered part of a character.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrSpacingOptions.MaximumHorizontalElementSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum horizontal spacing, in pixels, allowed between character elements to train or read the character elements as a single character. This value cannot exceed the minimum value of CharSizeRange. The minimum acceptable value for this parameter is 0.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrSpacingOptions.CharSizeRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum and maximum number of pixels required for an object to be a potentially identifiable character. The minimum acceptable value for this parameter is 1. The maximum value cannot exceed MinimumCharSpacing.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.OcrSpacingOptions.MinimumCharSpacing
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum amount of space, in pixels, that can be between characters. This value cannot be less than MaximumHorizontalElementSpacing.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ParticleClassifierLocalThresholdOptions.DeviationWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the k constant used in the Niblack local thresholding algorithm, which determines the weight applied to the variance calculation. Valid k constants range from 0 to 1. Settings this value to 0 will increase the performance of the method because the method will not calculate the variance for any of the pixels. The method ignores this value if Method is not set to NiBlack.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ParticleClassifierLocalThresholdOptions.WindowHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the height of the rectangular window around the pixel on which the method performs the local threshold. This number must be at least 3 and cannot be larger than the height of an image being classified.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ParticleClassifierLocalThresholdOptions.WindowWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the rectangular window around the pixel on which the method performs the local threshold. This number must be at least 3 and cannot be larger than the width of an image being classified.

member.summary: Gets or sets what kind of particles to look for.

member.summary: Gets or sets the type of local thresholding the method uses.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ParticleClassifierOptions.MirrorDependence
member.summary:
Gets or sets the relative importance of mirror symmetry when classifying particles. This value ranges from 0 to 1000.
An example of objects exhibiting mirror symmetry are the lowercase letters p and q. If MirrorDependence is 0, the samples are classified independent of mirror symmetry. For example, p and q would be classified as the same class.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ParticleClassifierOptions.ScaleDependence
member.summary: Gets or sets the relative importance (between 0 and 1000) of scale when classifying particles. If the value is 0, the samples are classified independent of scale.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRSearchOptions.SkewDegreesAllowed
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount, in degrees, of skew in the QR code the method should allow for.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRSearchOptions.CellFilterMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the mode the method uses to determine the pixel value for each cell.
member.remarks: If CellSampleSize is Size1x1, the value of the single sampled pixel always determines the pixel value for the cell and the method ignores this property.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRSearchOptions.CellSampleSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the sample size, in pixels, the method should take to determine if each cell is on or off.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRSearchOptions.DemodulationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the mode the method should use to demodulate (determine which cells are on and which cells are off) the QR code.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRSearchOptions.EdgeThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum contrast a pixel must have in order to be considered part of a QR code cell edge.
member.remarks: The lower this value, the more potential edge candidates the method will examine during the location phase. Setting this value too low will decrease the performance of the method because the method will examine too many potential edge candidates. Setting this value too high may also decrease the performance of the method by removing valid edge candidates, making location require more iterations. Setting this value too high may also cause the method to fail to identify the QR code because all edge candidates are eliminated.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRSearchOptions.SkipLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets if the method should locate the code. If , specifies that the method should assume that the QR code occupies the entire image (or the entire search region). The method then skips the location phase, moving immediately to extraction and decoding. If , the method does not make any assumptions about the percentage of the image occupied by the QR code.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.QRSearchOptions.RotationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of QR code rotation the method should allow for.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixDescriptionOptions.MirrorMode
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Data Matrix barcode appears normally in the image or if the barcode appears mirrored in the image.
member.remarks:
You can use the following constants with this data type:
—The method should determine if the Data Matrix barcode is mirrored.
—The method should expect the Data Matrix barcode to appear mirrored.
-The method should expect the Data Matrix barcode to appear normal.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixDescriptionOptions.MinimumBorderIntegrity
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum percentage of the border (locator pattern and timing pattern) the method should expect in the Data Matrix barcode.
member.remarks: During the location phase, the method will ignore possible Data Matrix barcode candidates that do not have at least this level of border integrity.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixDescriptionOptions.CellFill
member.summary: Gets or sets the fill percentage for a cell of the Data Matrix barcode that is in the "on" state.
member.remarks:
You can use the following constants with this data type:
—The method determines the Data Matrix barcode cell fill percentage automatically.
—The method reads Data Matrix barcodes with a cell fill percentage of less than 30 percent.
—The method reads Data Matrix barcodes with a cell fill percentage greater than or equal to 30 percent.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixDescriptionOptions.Polarity
member.summary: Gets or sets the data-to-background contrast for the Data Matrix barcode.
member.remarks:
You can use the following constants with this data type:
—The method should determine the polarity of the Data Matrix barcode.
-The method should search for a Data Matrix barcode with dark data on a bright background.
—The method should search for a Data Matrix barcode with bright data on a dark background.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixDescriptionOptions.Ecc
member.summary: Gets or sets the ECC used for this Data Matrix barcode.
member.remarks:
You can use the following constants with this data type:
—Sets the method to read Data Matrix barcodes of ECC 000 only.
-Sets the method to read Data Matrix barcodes of ECC 000, ECC 050, ECC 080, ECC 100, and ECC 140 only.
-Sets the method to read Data Matrix barcodes of ECC 050 only.
-Sets the method to read Data Matrix barcodes of ECC 080 only.
—Sets the method to read Data Matrix barcodes of ECC 100 only.
-Sets the method to read Data Matrix barcodes of ECC 140 only.
-Sets the method to read Data Matrix barcodes of ECC 200 only.
—The method determines the barcode ECC automatically.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixDescriptionOptions.Rectangle
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Data Matrix barcode is rectangular.
member.value: If this element is , the method will look for Data Matrix barcodes of all shapes. If this element is , the method will only look for Data Matrix barcodes that are square. The default is .
member.remarks: If both Rows and Columns are non-zero, the method will ignore this property.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixDescriptionOptions.Columns
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of columns in the Data Matrix barcode.
member.value: The default is 0, which specifies that the method should determine the number of columns.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixDescriptionOptions.Rows
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of rows in the Data Matrix barcode.
member.value: The default is 0, which specifies that the method should determine the number of rows.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixDescriptionOptions.AspectRatio
member.summary: Gets or sets the ratio of the width of a Data Matrix barcode cell (in pixels) divided by the height of a Data Matrix barcode cell (in pixels).
member.value: The default is 0.0, which specifies that the method should determine the aspect ratio.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixSearchOptions.InitialSearchVectorWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of pixels the method should average together to determine the location of an edge.
member.remarks: You may need to increase this value when the Data Matrix barcode has cells with a low fill percentage.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixSearchOptions.MaximumIterations
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of iterations before the method stops looking for the Data Matrix barcode.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixSearchOptions.SkewDegreesAllowed
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of skew in the Data Matrix barcode that the method should allow for.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixSearchOptions.CellFilterMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the the mode the method uses to determine the pixel value for each cell.
member.remarks:
You can use the following constants with this data type:
—The method tries each filter mode, starting with cwimaqDataMatrixCellFilterModeAverage and ending with cwimaqDataMatrixCellFilterModeVeryLowAverage, stopping once a filter mode decodes correctly.
—The method will try all filter modes and uses the one that decodes the Data Matrix barcode within the fewest iterations and utilizing the least amount of error correction.
—The method sets the pixel value for the cell to the average of the sampled pixels.
—The method sets the pixel value for the cell to the average of the pixels in the center of the cell sample.
—The method sets the pixel value for the cell to the average value of the half of the sampled pixels with the highest pixel values.
—The method sets the pixel value for the cell to the average value of the half of the sampled pixels with the lowest pixel values.
—The method sets the pixel value for the cell to the median of the sampled pixels.
—The method sets the pixel value for the cell to the average value of the ninth of the sampled pixels with the highest pixel values.
—The method sets the pixel value for the cell to the average value of the ninth of the sampled pixels with the lowest pixel values.
If CellSampleSize is , the value of the single sampled pixel always determines the pixel value for the cell and the method ignores this property.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixSearchOptions.CellSampleSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the sample size, in pixels, the method should take to determine if each cell is on or off.
member.remarks:
You can use the following constants with this data type:
—The method will use a 1×1 sized sample from each cell.
—The method will use a 2×2 sized sample from each cell.
—The method will use a 3×3 sized sample from each cell.
—The method will use a 4×4 sized sample from each cell.
—The method will use a 5×5 sized sample from each cell.
—The method will use a 6×6 sized sample from each cell.
—The method will use a 7×7 sized sample from each cell.
—The method will try each sample size and use the one which decodes the Data Matrix barcode within the fewest iterations and utilizing the least amount of error correction.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixSearchOptions.DemodulationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the mode the method should use to demodulate (determine which cells are on and which cells are off) the Data Matrix barcode.
member.remarks:
You can use the following constants with this data type:
—The method tries DataMatrixDemodulationModeHistogram, then DataMatrixDemodulationModeLocalContrast and then DataMatrixDemodulationModeCombined, stopping once one mode is successful.
—The method will try each demodulation mode and use the one which decodes the Data Matrix barcode within the fewest iterations and utilizing the least amount of error correction.
—The method uses the histogram of the Data Matrix barcode to calculate a threshold. For cells with pixel values that are sufficiently below or above this threshold, the method will use the threshold to determine if the cell is on or off. If the cell pixel values are close to the threshold, the method will use the DataMatrixDemodulationModeLocalContrast mode to determine if the cell is on or off. This mode is slower, but works with images that contain a Data Matrix barcode with extremely low cell fill percentages or gross print growth errors.
—The method uses a histogram of all of the Data Matrix cells to calculate a threshold. This threshold determines if a cell is on or off. This is the fastest mode, but requires images with consistent levels of contrast.
—The method examines each of the cell's neighbors to determine if the cell is on or off. This mode is slower, but works with images that have inconsistent levels of contrast.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixSearchOptions.EdgeThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum contrast a pixel must have in order to be considered part of a Data Matrix barcode cell edge.
member.remarks: The lower this value, the more potential edge candidates the method will examine during the location phase. Setting this value too low will decrease the performance of the method because the method will examine too many potential edge candidates. Setting this value too high may also decrease the performance of the method by removing valid edge candidates, making location require more iterations. Setting this value too high may also cause the method to fail to identify the Data Matrix barcode because all edge candidates are eliminated.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixSearchOptions.SkipLocation
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the method should locate the barcode.
member.remarks: If , specifies that the method should assume that the Data Matrix barcode occupies the entire image (or the entire search region). The method then skips the location phase, moving immediately to extraction and decoding. If , the method does not make any assumptions about the percentage of the image occupied by the Data Matrix barcode.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DataMatrixSearchOptions.RotationMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of Data Matrix barcode rotation the function should allow for.
member.remarks:
You can use the following constants with this data type:
—The method allows for ± 5 degrees of rotation.
—The method allows for between 175 and 185 degrees of rotation.
—The method allows for between 265 and 275 degrees of rotation.
—The method allows for between 85 and 95 degrees of rotation.
—The method allows for unlimited rotation.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.EdgeOptions.ColumnProcessingMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the processing mode used to find the straight edge.
member.remarks:
You can use the following constants with this data type:
Average—Uses the average of a column.
Median—Uses the median of a column.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.EdgeOptions.InterpolationType
member.summary: Gets or sets the interpolation method used to locate the edge position.
member.remarks:
You can use the following constants with this data type:
Bilinear—The function uses an interpolation method that interpolates new pixel values using a bidirectional average of the neighboring pixels.
BilinearFixed—The function uses an interpolation method that interpolates new pixel values using bilinear fixed interpolation.
Cubic—The function uses an interpolation method that interpolates new pixel values by fitting them to a cubic spline curve, where the curve is based on known pixel values from the image.
Quadratic—The function uses an interpolation method that interpolates new pixel values using a quadratic approximating polynomial.
ZeroOrder—The function uses an interpolation method that interpolates new pixel values using the nearest valid neighboring pixel.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.EdgeOptions.MinimumThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum edge strength, also known as the gradient magnitude, required for a detected edge.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.EdgeOptions.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of pixels averaged perpendicular to the search direction to compute the edge profile strength at each point along the search region.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.EdgeOptions.KernelSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the size of the edge detection kernel.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.EdgeOptions.Polarity
member.summary: Gets or sets the polarity of the edges to be found.
member.remarks:
You can use the following constants with this data type:
All—Search for all edges.
Falling—Search for falling edges.
Rising—Search for rising edges.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the method identifies the location of curves with subpixel accuracy by interpolating between points to find the crossing of the threshold.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.CurveOptions.OnlyClosed
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the method identifies only closed curves in the image.
member.value: The default value is , which specifies that the method identifies both open and closed curves.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.CurveOptions.MaximumEndPointGap
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum gap, in pixels, between the endpoints of a curve that the function identifies as a closed curve.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.CurveOptions.ColumnStepSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance, in the x direction, between columns of pixels in the image that the method inspects for curve seed points.
member.value: Valid values for this property range from 1 to 255. The default value is 15.
member.remarks: Set this value to be smaller than the minimum width of the object you want to detect in the image.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.CurveOptions.RowStepSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance, in the y direction, between lines that the method inspects for curve seed points.
member.value: The default value is 15. Valid values for this property range from 1 to 255.
member.remarks: Set this value to be smaller than the minimum height of objects you want to detect in the image.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.CurveOptions.MinimumLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the length, in pixels, of the smallest curve the method will extract.
member.remarks: This property ignores curves that have a length less than MinimumLength pixels.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.CurveOptions.FilterSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the edge filter the method uses to identify curves in the image.
member.value: The default value for this property is .
member.remarks:
You can use the following enumeration values with this data type:
—Specifies that the function uses a fine, or narrow, edge filter.
—Specifies that the function uses a normal edge filter.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.CurveOptions.Threshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum contrast a seed point must have for the method to begin a curve.
member.value: The default value is 75. Valid values for this property range from 1 to 360.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.CurveOptions.ExtractionMode
member.summary: Gets or sets how the method identifies curves in the image.
member.remarks:
You can use the following enumeration values with this data type:
—Specifies that the method makes no assumptions about the uniformity of objects in the image or the image background.
—Specifies that the method assumes that either the objects in the image or the image background consists of uniform pixel values.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.BcgOptions.Gamma
member.summary: Gets or sets the gamma correction of an image.
member.remarks: The default value of 1.0 is neutral. Values below 1.0 enhance contrast for darker pixels at the expense of brighter pixels. Values above 1.0 enhance contrast for brighter pixels at the expense of darker pixels.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.BcgOptions.Contrast
member.summary: Gets or sets the contrast of an image.
member.remarks: The default value of 45 leaves the contrast unchanged. Values below 45 decrease the contrast, and values above 45 increase the contrast.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.BcgOptions.Brightness
member.summary: Gets or sets the brightness of an image.
member.remarks: The default value of 128 leaves the brightness unchanged. Values below 128 darken the image, and values above 128 brighten the image.

member.name: T:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DetectPeaksOrValleysOptions
member.summary: Provides the location, amplitude, and second derivative of peaks or valleys in the input array.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DetectPeaksOrValleysOptions.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DetectPeaksOrValleysOptions class.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DetectPeaksOrValleysOptions.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DetectPeaksOrValleysOptions class.
member.param: The number of consecutive data points to use in the quadratic least-squares fit. The value must be greater than or equal to 3 but should be no larger than one-quarter of the approximate width of the peaks or valleys. Large widths may reduce the apparent amplitude and shift the apparent location of peaks. This parameter has a default value of 3.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DetectPeaksOrValleysOptions.#ctor(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the DetectPeaksOrValleysOptions class.
member.param: The number of consecutive data points to use in the quadratic least-squares fit. The value must be greater than or equal to 3 but should be no larger than one-quarter of the approximate width of the peaks or valleys. Large widths may reduce the apparent amplitude and shift the apparent location of peaks. This parameter has a default value of 3.

Rejects peaks or valleys that are too small. Any peak found with a fitted amplitude that is less than threshold is ignored. Valleys are ignored if the fitted trough is greater than threshold. This parameter has a default value of 0.

member.name: M:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DetectPeaksOrValleysOptions.Equals(NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DetectPeaksOrValleysOptions)

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DetectPeaksOrValleysOptions.Width
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of consecutive data points to use in the quadratic least-squares fit.
member.remarks: The property value must be greater than or equal to 3 but should be no larger than one-quarter of the approximate width of the peaks or valleys. Large widths may reduce the apparent amplitude and shift the apparent location of peaks.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.DetectPeaksOrValleysOptions.Threshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the fitted amplitude of peaks and valleys.
member.remarks: Rejects peaks or valleys that are too small. Any peak found with a fitted amplitude that is less than Threshold is ignored. Valleys are ignored if the fitted trough is greater than Threshold.

member.remarks:
You can use the following constants with this data type:
—Indicates that the origin point is in the center of the text. In other words, half of the text appears to the left of the origin and half is to the right of the origin.
—Indicates that the text appears to the left of the origin point.
—Indicates that the text appears to the right of the origin point.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.CannyOptions.ThresholdRange
member.summary: Gets or sets the threshold of pixel values in the image from which the edge detection algorithm chooses the seed or starting point of an edge segment.
member.value: The minimum default value is 0.2. The maximum default value is 0.7.
member.remarks: The minimum property is multiplied by the maximum to define a lower threshold for all the pixels in an edge segment. For the maximum property, you can choose values from 0 to 1.

member.summary: Gets or sets the sigma of the Gaussian smoothing filter that the method applies to the image before edge detection.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchColorPatternOptions.MinimumMatchScore
member.summary: Gets or sets the smallest score a match must have to be considered valid.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchColorPatternOptions.NumberOfMatchesRequested
member.summary: Gets or sets the number of valid matches expected.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchColorPatternOptions.SubpixelAccuracy
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the match results are returned with subpixel accuracy. This option is ignored if FeatureMode is set to Color. Set this parameter to to return areas in the image that match the pattern area with subpixel accuracy.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchColorPatternOptions.MinimumContrast
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum contrast expected in the shape features of the color image.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchColorPatternOptions.MatchMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the technique to use when looking for the color template pattern in the color image.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchColorPatternOptions.FeatureMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the features to use when looking for the color template pattern in the color image.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchColorPatternOptions.ColorWeight
member.summary: Gets or sets the percent contribution of the color score to the final color pattern matching score. Acceptable values range from 0 to 1000.
member.value: The default is 500, indicating that the match score uses an equal combination of the color and shape scores.
member.remarks: The algorithm uses the color score weight for the final match ranking. For example, if you use a weight of 1000, the algorithm finds each match by using both color and shape information and then ranks the matches based on their color scores. If the weight is 0, the matches are ranked based on their shape scores.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchColorPatternOptions.ColorSensitivity
member.summary: Gets or sets the level of sensitivity used to describe the color features in the image.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.MatchColorPatternOptions.SearchStrategy
member.summary: Gets or sets the search strategy.

member.summary: Gets or sets a range that specifies the sizes of the shapes you expect to be in the image, expressed as a ratio percentage representing the size of the pattern in the image divided by size of the original pattern multiplied by 100. The method ignores this range if the Mode does not include ScaleInvariant.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.ShapeDetectionOptions.RotationAngleRanges
member.summary: Gets or sets an array of angle ranges, in degrees, where each range specifies how much you expect the shape to be rotated in the image. To decrease the search time, limit the degrees of rotation in which you expect to find the shape in the image. Pass null or Nothing for this element to allow all angles. The ranges are ignored if the Mode does not include RotationInvariant.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.CurveParameters.SubpixelAccuracy
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the method identifies the location of curves with subpixel accuracy by interpolating between points to find the crossing of the threshold.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.CurveParameters.MaximumEndPointGap
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum gap, in pixels, between the endpoints of a curve that the function identifies as a closed curve.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.CurveParameters.SearchStepSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance, in the y direction, between rows of pixels in the image that the method inspects for curve seed points.
member.value: Valid values for this property range from 1 to 255. The default value is 15.
member.remarks: Set this value to be smaller than the minimum width of the object you want to detect in the image.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.CurveParameters.MinimumLength
member.summary: Gets or sets the length, in pixels, of the smallest curve the method will extract.
member.remarks: This property ignores curves that have a length less than MinimumLength pixels.

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.CurveParameters.FilterSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the width of the edge filter the method uses to identify curves in the image.
member.value: The default value for this property is .

member.name: P:NationalInstruments.Vision.Analysis.CurveParameters.Threshold
member.summary: Gets or sets the minimum contrast a seed point must have for the method to begin a curve.
member.value: The default value is 75. Valid values for this property range from 1 to 360.

member.summary: Gets or sets how the method identifies curves in the image.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the function overlays the hit lines to the object and the edge used to generate the hit line on the result image.
member.remarks: If , the function overlays the hit lines to the object and the edge used to generate the hit line on the result image. When applicable, the function also overlays the location of any measurements made by the function. If you do not want this information overlaid onto the image, set this element to .
